loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
This is Eunice. She is 32 years old and a mother of three children. Two of her children are in primary school. Eunice is a vegetable farmer and she operates a dairy. Hand in Hand-Eastern Africa’s training has enabled her improve her skills on enterprise development, record keeping, and also financial management.

Eunice is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and dairy feed. She believes her Kiva loan will further boost her business by improving her crop yield and her milk production, thus providing a greater supply of vegetables and milk. Eunice hopes her income will increase and that she will be able to pay for her children’s school fees. She is happy for Kiva and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and dairy feed

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish.

Manilyn has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Manilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Esther, fifty years old and blessed with three children. She lives with her husband and their two children. She is a dairy farmer. Some of the milk produced is for domestic use and the rest is put into commercial purposes.

Esther has applied for a loan to buy a water tank for harvesting water for both domestic use and her dairy cows. This will ensure her cows remain healthy, thus maintaining a steady milk production. She plans to use the anticipated income to cater for the family's daily needs.

She is very happy for Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for harvesting water to ensure a steady supply of milk production.

loans.name: Levina

texts.en:
Levina is in her late 50s, married, and has four grown children. She is currently running a business selling airtime, juices, water, stationery, and tigo pesa and airtel money. She has been in this business for four years now, working from 7 am to 9 pm each working day. Levina is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her 11th credit request via Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, since repaid, to buy stationery, water, soda, juices, and to buy airtime. Levina earned extra profits, which she used to cover part of her household expenses. She is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy juices, airtime, exercise books, etc. She is so happy and thankful to everyone who will support her business and life. Levina will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy juices, airtime, exercise books, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of materials for his shoe-making business.

loans.name: Al Rihab 1 Group

texts.en:
Kammoun is the featured borrower for Al Rihab 1 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Kammoun is a 53-year-old married mother of six children who has worked twenty years in a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of her family. 

Kammoun is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business and provide her family with better living conditions, as she has a good reputation among her customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with more products, to satisfy her customers' needs in the Christmas season.

Kammoun is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Nouhad is the lady sitting in the middle, and Rihab is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with more products to satisfy her customers' needs in the Christmas season

loans.name: Evalin

texts.en: Evalin is a married woman. She has two children, whose ages are 4 years and 10 years. She describes herself as caring. She operates a retail business, where she sells fish (dried omena). She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a larger stock of fish to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. She will use the anticipated profits to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of fish.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail shop where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosanna works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income by fattening pigs. 

Rosanna is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs and sugar. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosanna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs and sugar

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emmalinda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business. Emmalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF.

Emmalinda is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business such as a fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, and other items. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as a fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, and other items

loans.name: Mackline

texts.en:
Mackline is aged 28 married with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a Primary School as her main business and also operates a shoe business selling used shoes. She managed to work hard and get income to pay school fees for her children.

She engaged herself in the above business in order to provide her family with the basic needs. She faces a challenge of inadequate capital and dreams of educating her children to a level of self dependency. Mackline intends to use the loan to buy second hand shoes to sell.

The photo was taken from her main business at school with the children she teaches.

loans.use: to buy second hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rabilu

texts.en:
Rabilu is a maize farmer from Danju Gubuchi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rabilu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabilu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Rabilu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to buy food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maa Bindhyabasini Shg Group

texts.en:
Sasmita is a member of Maa Bindhyabasini SHG along with 11 other members. All of them belong to a small village named Rampur, which is situated in Sambalpur District, Odisha. Sasmita is 43 years old and lives with her two children and husband. Her husband is a daily wage laborer who works hard to feed their family even for two meals. She is a housewife but she has a desire to work hard and contribute to increase her family's income so that she will be able to make her children happy and satisfy their hunger. So, she decided to start a small tea stall outside her house. For that, she, along with her group, requested a loan to make a step forward to fulfill her needs. She will use her portion to buy a gas cylinder, pots and supplies for her tea making and selling shop.

She is planning to offer breakfast and snacks with tea to her customers. She hopes to do well in business. She is very thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder, pots and supplies for her tea making and selling shop.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Suryakanti, who is in her late 50s, is married with eight children, four of whom are still dependent on her. She has been selling fish for 15 years now. She works from 5:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Suryakanti's first loan from Peoples Forum. She will use this loan to buy more fish to resell. She dreams of finishing building her house, which was started two years ago. Suryakanti is not more educated, but she wants to educate her children, and for this, she works hard to earn more.

Suryakanti will share this loan with her loan group, Maa Santoshi Shg, which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Edna has been running her business for 5 years, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She plans to buy ingredients for her business.

In the future, Edna would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mairambek

texts.ru: Майрамбек, 48 лет, женат, есть 2 детей школьного возраста. У Майрамбека средне-специальное образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы. Также он арендует 3,0 Га земли, где выращивает клевер и ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Бизнес Майрамбека в месяц приносит около 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коров. Доходы от кредита Майрамбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mairambek is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Mairambek has a secondary-specialized education. As an additional source of income for his family, he has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming since 2000. Thanks to Mairambek's hard work, he currently has 4 cows on his farm. He also rents a 3.0 hectare plot of land on which he grows clover and barley for personal consumption. Mairambek's business brings in an average monthly income of 30,000 som (KGS). For the further development of his business, he turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan for 130,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of his herd by buying cows. Mairambek plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional cows to fatten up and resell.

loans.name: Manasa Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Rekha is the featured borrower of “Manasa Mahila Samuha”. Rekha is a housewife and her husband is a carpenter. They live in a rural area of Deoghar District in Jharkhand. They have two children, both are in school. Rekha’s husband is the only earning member of the family. Initially he was working as a labor under building contractor, now he is small construction contractor. 

The family needs some working capital to run the business smoothly. Rekha wants the loan to buy more equipment's for her husband's construction business. The family has a desire to establish this business on large scale in Deoghar and to educate their children. 

Like Rekha, the other four members are also seeking loans to improve their livelihood for which they are in need of sufficient capital. Your loan will help five hardworking and deserving families take a big step towards improving their lives.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for the construction business.

loans.name: Makala Group

texts.en:
Awinanesi is a woman, aged 40, who supports her family by selling pots and plates. She is in the bottom-left corner of this picture. She is doing this business, to be financially independent and to be able to pay school fees for her children. She has four children, and some of her children are married.

She will use the loan to develop and start up a new business, because she wants to open a butchery. She hopes to successfully open the new business, and hopes to have an improved living standard. Accessing loans from Kiva has helped her to reduce her family’s poverty level.

loans.use: to buy pots and plates.

loans.name: Zebojon

texts.en:
Zebojon is a hardworking woman who was born in 1972. She is married and lives in a rural area. Zebojon works with livestock and she has four horned cattle. She keeps her cattle at her home and sells them at the local market. Her husband helps her with her business and they also sell dairy products. 

Zebojon is requesting a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб сейчас учится в третьем курсе Худжандского Государственного Университета. Он успешно продолжает свою учебу благодаря поддержке кредиторов Kiva, которые поддержали его при первом кредитовании. Сухроб уже погасил предыдущий кредит и теперь намерен получить повторный кредит с той же целью, то есть для оплаты за учебу и покупки необходимых учебных принадлежностей. Сухроб надеется и в этот раз получить финансовую поддержку, потому что в настоящий момент его главная цель в жизни - получение высшего экономического образования. Свою мечту он сможет реализовать только с вашей помощи.
texts.en: Suhrob is now in his third year at Khujand State University. He is successfully continuing his studies thanks to Kiva, who supported his first loan. Suhrob also repaid back his previous loan and now is determined to receive a second loan to pay for his tuition and buy necessary school supplies. Suhrob needs to receive financial support this time around because the most important driving force in his life these days is receiving his higher education in economics. He will be able to fulfill his dream only with your support.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition and purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno is a married woman. She has one child who is 18 years old. She operates a retail business where she sells liquid washing soap. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are individuals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of liquid soap to sell. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of liquid soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
La socia Margoth se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Margoth, earns a living with a crafts business selling textiles, sweaters, blankets, and looms.  She works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  She has been in the business for eight years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her textile and loom business.

She's requesting the loan to buy textiles, sweaters, and looms.

Margoth is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy textiles, sweaters, and looms

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells nipa roofing in the Philippines and has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this nipa business for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending, buying and selling dried coconut meat, and operating a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Elizabeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Aisa

texts.en:
Aisa is 54 years old and married with three children. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from vending food. Aisa works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 11 previous NWTF loans.

Aisa is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other products. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
Bonny who lives in Hoima Uganda, is aged thirty four. He is a hard-working, married, man charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children of ages 11, 7, 5, 3 who all attend school.

He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, beans, rice among other items. He has hopes of developing and expanding his business into new market areas. However, bad weather hinders his desire.

Bonny intends to use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta is 55 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Laureta has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 59 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Suzette sells Avon products in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional Avon products to sell. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future Suzette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old living in the village of Mundri County of  South Sudan. A loan of 300 SSP helps she to pay for products, sweets,basics and variety .

loans.use: To purchase more  items .

loans.name: Kuibanga Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in this photograph is Faith. She is 38 years old, married, and a mother of three. Training by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development has helped her realize her strength in business. Faith is engaged in a full-time business as a dairy farmer and she sells her products in the local market. 

Faith is requesting a loan through Kiva to buy quality fodder for her cows to help improve milk production. Her loan will help improve her income and she will use the profit from her loan to provide for her family’s basic needs such as food and clothing. Faith is very happy for Kiva’s financial support.

loans.use: to buy quality fodder for her cows to improve milk production

loans.name: Eduvijes

texts.en:
Eduvijes is 62 years old, married, and has 6 children, one of whom is in school. Eduvijes works very hard to provide for all of them.

Eduvijes runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been running her business for 18 years. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Eduvijes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elena is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gildardo

texts.es:
Él es Gildardo un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad que inicio solo y sin ayuda un cultivo de flores, dicha actividad la inicio como necesidad y aprendió del negocio gracias a que trabajaba como auxiliar de cultivos de flores.
Gildardo es consciente que para este negocio necesita de capital de mucho trabajo y de esfuerzo y más que es un hombre que trabaja solo y es por ello que quiere apoyarse en la alianza Kiva-Interactuar buscando un soporte financiero para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos, fertilizantes.
Su sueño más anhelado es comprar casa, un sueño del que muchos le cuestionan pero fue capaz de montar su propio negocio, ahora el reto de adquirir vivienda no le quedara grande, apóyalo y ayúdalo a cumplir su deseo
texts.en:
Gildardo is a young 22 year old entrepreneur who alone and without help began a business growing flowers. He started it as a necessity and learned the business thanks to the work he used to do as an assistant flower grower. Gildardo is aware that for this business he needs a lot of effort and capital and more than one man alone can do. So he seeks support through the Kiva-Interactuar alliance, seeking financial support to invest in buying manure, irrigation, and fertilizers. His dream is to buy his own home, a dream that many question; but he was capable of starting his own business, now the goal of having his own home doesn't seem so impossible.

Support him and help him fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to buy manure, irrigation, and fertilizers for his flowers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 31 years old  lives in Lui town  Western Equatoria state region of South  Sudan.  A loan of 500 SSP will help her to pay for rent.

loans.use: To Purchase more for the customers

loans.name: Rashol

texts.en: Rashol is a 30-year-old mother of four children from Lui, Western Equatoria state region of  South Sudan. A loan of 500 SSP  help her to pay  for  food and products (meat,chicken)to keep up with customer demand.

loans.use: To  buy more goods

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Eleonora works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Eleonora is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, etc. for her furniture making business.

Eleonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, etc.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 42 years old, and she is married with 7 children - 5 of whom are in school. Elna works very hard to provide for all of them.

Elna runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, a business she has been running for the past 6 years. Elna has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 50-year-old married mother of 3 children. Her husband is currently abroad, seeking to earn a better income. Meanwhile, since 2004, Jamila has been working as a tailor from her house in order to help support their family. 

Jamila is a hard worker, well-known in her region for her special talents and good prices. She has acquired a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will invest in a car for her son to start his own business. She will also use the loan to help with her family's living expenses.

Jamila is working hard to one day open her own factory and recruit others to help her fill the increasing orders from her customers.

loans.use: to both buy a car for her son to start his own business and cover her family's living expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Elsa Del Carmen

texts.es: Elsa cuenta con 32 años de vida y buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos económicos de su hogar decidió montar una pequeña tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda hace 3 años en los cuales ha logrado ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos que se han convertido en sus mejores clientes. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad que es su mayor alegría y la razón de su esfuerzo. Elsa sabe que en la época navideña siempre son mayores las ventas por lo que quiere preparar su tienda para que tenga la mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lácteos, detergente, embutidos, carnes, pollo, café, azúcar, etc. Para tener mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa, 32, looking for a way to help her husband with the household expenses, decided to set up a small store with staple products in her home three years ago.  She has been able to earn the trust of her neighbors, who have become her best customers.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her young son, 4, who is her greatest joy and the reason for her efforts.

Elsa knows that there are always more sales during the Christmas season, so she wants to get her store ready to have the greatest number of products to sell to her customers.  She's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in dairy products, detergent, canned goods, meat, chicken, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, detergents, canned goods, meat, chicken, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Catherine works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Catherine is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, spices, eggs and milk.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Catherine has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, spices, eggs and milk

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melisa es una joven de 25 años de edad, soltera, sonriente, disfruta la vida y de momento no tiene hijos pero aspira a tener una familia.
Inicio el negocio de la confección de colchados y ropa, actividad que inicio por gusto y que aprendió gracias a clases y capacitaciones que tuvo.
Esta joven es muy creativa y trata siempre de superarse pues no solo confecciona ropa si no que ella misma sale y la vende.
La falta de capital le ha quitado la posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida, perdiendo clientes importantes solo pro no tener dinero para comprar la materia prima. Pensando en este problema y con la ayuda de la sociedad Kiva-Interactuar Melisa quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de telas, acolchados e insumos para trabajar fuertemente esta temporada de diciembre.
Su meta es ser reconocida en el sector y tener trabajo todo el próximo año que se avecina
texts.en: Melisa is a 25 year old young woman, single, who smiles and enjoys life in the moment. She doesn't have children but hopes to have a family one day. She began a business selling pillows and clothing, a business she began because she enjoys the work that she learned through the training classes she took. This young woman is very creative and always tries to surpass herself as she not only makes clothing but she herself also goes out and sells it.  The lack of capital has stopped her from the possibility of improving her quality of life, losing important customers only because she didn't have the money to buy the materials she needed.  Thinking about this problem and with the help of Kiva-Interactuar,  Melisa wants a loan to buy materials such as thread and fabrics to work a lot in preparation of the December season. Her goal is to be recognized in the area and to have work in the upcoming year.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread and fabric.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad un área caracterizada por el comercio informal y manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía en el transcurso del día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Zenobia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte como taxi y su hijo que estudia en la escuela y juega futbol. La familia vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña, platos como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), Locro Carretero (incluye arroz, charque y plátano, papa, cebolla verde y huevo), Rapi al jugo (carne de res cocida y acompañada con arroz y yuca), y otros. Su labor la realiza durante todos los días de la semana en horario de almuerzo y cena. “el clima del lugar hace que tengamos variedad de vegetales y sabores exquisitos, la cocina que elaboro es variada y mis clientes son continuos y constantes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante con ayudantes y todo tipo de comidas. Ella dese ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de muebles como; mesas y sillas y también insumos de cocina como; yuca, harina, arroz, charque, plátano, etc., por mayor, para cocinar en la época de las fiestas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad es por esos motivos que Zenobia solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su comedor para atender a muchos clientes durante las fiestas venideras.
texts.en:
Zenobia is a 36 years old woman who lives with her partner and has a 16 year old son. She sells traditional food from the area. She is a business woman, a good mother, cheerful, positive, happy, has a good attitude, responsible and a hard-worker. Her business is in the south area of the city, an area known for informal businesses and manufactures of all kinds.  The weather is warm, tropical and humid and the temperature varies during the course of the day anywhere from 21-35 degrees Celsius.

Zenobia has a dark complexion, long black hair and is short in stature. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish because of the culture and because of the type of work she does. She shares her life with her partner who is a taxi driver and with her son who goes to school and plays soccer. The family lives in their own home built of brick, has electricity, drinking water and sewage.

She sells traditional food from the area, such as Majadito de Charque (dehydrated meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), Sopa de Remojado (bone, corn and bean soup), Cogote Relleno (chicken neck, stuffed with potato or with chicken gizzard), Locro Carretero (with rice, dried meat, plantain, potato, green onion and egg), Rapi al Jugo (beef with rice and cassava), etc. She works every weekday serving lunch and dinner. “The climate of the place helps us have a variety of vegetables and exquisite flavors, my cuisine is varied and my clients are long-term and consistent” she says. Her dream is to have a restaurant with staff and to offer all types of foods.

She would like to expand her business by purchasing furniture such as tables and chairs and also food ingredients such as cassava, flour, rice, dried meat, plantain, etc. in bulk, to cook during the holiday season. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years that she has been working. This is why Zenobia asks for a loan, to expand her dining area and to be able to service a lot of clients during the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: to expand the dining area to service a lot of clients during the upcoming holiday season.

loans.name: Sara Magdalena

texts.es: Sara de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con un hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sara is 31 years old, a single mother who lives in her own home with her son. She has had a small store located in her home for several years. She has many customers for her good prices. She seeks a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, candy, sweet bread, etc. and in this way be able to have greater income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling fish in the Philippines.

Evelyn has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy boxes of fish to sell.

Evelyn has been running her business for 30 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 28 лет, замужем, детей нет. Венера занимается торговлей кондитерскими изделиями на рынке города, начав свой бизнес в 2010 году. Благодаря упорному труду, у Венеры на сегодняшний день имеется товар в обороте на сумму 50,000 сом (KGS). Перед праздниками Венера прогнозирует большой спрос на кондитерские изделия, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS), на покупку кондитерских изделий: тортов, булочек, пирожных для перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния ее семьи, чтобы в будущем были все условия для рождения ребенка.
texts.en: Venera is 28 years old, married and does not have any children. Venera runs a pastry stall at the city's market. She started this business in 2010. Thanks to Venera's hard work, she currently has merchandise in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). Before the holidays, Venera is predicting a large demand for pastries, which is why she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" to develop her business. She is requesting a loan for 120,000 som (KGS) to buy pastries: cakes, rolls and pies for retail sale. Venera plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the development of her business. She wants to improve her family's living conditions so that she will have the necessary circumstances to be able to have a baby.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods like cakes, rolls and pies for retail sale.

loans.name: Febe Lelanie

texts.en:
Febe Lelanie is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. 

Febe Lelanie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines, a business she has been running for 13 years.

Febe Lelanie has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy additional boxes of herbal products to sell.

Febe Lelanie hopes that, in the future, all of her children will finish their studies be able to help their family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Mukash

texts.ru: Мукаш, 53 года, разведена, есть сын, с Мукаш живет ее сын и невестка. Образование-среднее, с 2004 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Мукаш, на сегодняшний день она имеет 2 коровы. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Мукаш составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мукаш обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Mukash is 53 years old, divorced and has a son. Her son and his wife live with Mukash. She has a secondary education. Since 2004, she has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. Thanks to Mukash's hard work and patient personality, she currently has 2 cows on her farm. Her average cumulative income is 18,000 som (KGS), however this amount is catastrophically not enough for a decent life. For the further development of her farm, Mukash turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 150,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. She plans to invest the income from the loan in the further expansion of her business, which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
Хасан повторно обратился за кредитом на образование. Предыдущий кредит он брал для оплаты за учебу дочери в медицинском колледже. Тот кредит был полностью профинансирован кредиторами Kiva и Хасан им очень благодарен за большую поддержку, так как его дочь продолжает учебу. 
Сейчас снова наступил момент оплаты за годового контракта дочери и Хасан не имея сбережений на руках вынужден получить повторный кредит. На этот  раз ему не хватает всего 1500 долларов США. Он очень надеется, что и в этот раз ему окажут финансовую поддержку и верит в доброту и взаимопомощь людей.
texts.en:
Hasan is taking another education loan.  His first loan, which he took to pay his daughter's medical school tuition fees, was entirely financed by Kiva lenders.  Hasan is very grateful for all the support he received, as his daughter was able to pursue her studies.

Now again, Hasan needs to pay his daughter's annual tuition fees, and since he doesn't have any savings that he can use, he has no other option but to apply for a loan. For this second loan, he is only lacking 1,500 USD.  Hasan truly hopes that he will receive some support again.  He believes in people's generosity and mutual assistance.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's medical college tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Maribel works very hard to provide for her family.

Maribel is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as soap, canned goods, eggs, chips, and other items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soap, canned goods, eggs, chips, and other items

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is married with six children. She is 43 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlita has been in this business for 5 years.

Merlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like nets, ice boxes etc. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy needed materials like nets, ice boxes etc.

loans.name: Lady Yhoana

texts.es:
Lady es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera y vive con su hija. 

Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía por como ropa, calzado y accesorios; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar su sustento y el de su hijo. 

Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía (ropa, perfumería, accesorios, lencería) con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Lady is 28 years old, single and lives with her daughter.  Currently, she earns a living selling merchandise such as clothing, footwear and accessories.  She started this business thanks to the support of her family.  Through this business, she has been able to generate an income to provide for herself and her child.  She is a fighter and an entrepreneur with a desire to get ahead and continue with her business.

She is seeking a loan from Corporación Interactuar in order to invest it in purchasing an assortment of merchandise (clothing, fragrances, accessories, underwear), with the goal of increasing her sales and offering a wider variety of products to satisfy the diverse tastes and needs of her customers who are her friends and neighbors.  Her main goal is to have a greater supply, expand her clientele and increase her sales so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of merchandise including: clothing, fragrances, accessories and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fashionable clothes to sell, during the festive season

loans.name: Sokeng

texts.en:
Sokeng is 20 years old.  She is a second-year university student in a city and she has been majoring in accounting. She is from the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. 

Because of a shortage of finances, she would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate successfully with skills to build her future. After graduation, she wants a good job with a reasonable salary to help her family.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Minavarhan

texts.ru: Минавархан, 55 лет, замужем, есть двое сыновей. У Минавархан- средне-специальное образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2000 году, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Минавархан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 40 овец, 1 лошадь, а также имеет земельный надел размером 4,0 ГА, на котором она ежегодно выращивает клевер под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. Ежемесячный доход Минавархан составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Минавархан хочет сохранить и приумножить скот, чтобы иметь возможность накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Minavarhan is 55 years old, married and has two sons. Minavarhan has a secondary-specialized education. As an additional source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 2000 with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Minavarhan's hard work, she currently has 3 cows, 40 sheep and 1 horse on her farm. She also has a 4.0 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows clover for personal consumption and sale. Her average monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 135,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase her volume of organic milk sales. Minavarhan wants to protect and look after her cattle so that she will have the opportunity to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase cows to increase the volume of her organic milk sales.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El socio David continua dedicándose  al negocio de carpintería de estructuras metalicas,el socio lleva años de dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio continua haciendo ventanas, puertas entre otros, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas.
El socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner David continues to make a living through carpentry and building metal structures. The partner has spent years working in this business, which is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. He continues making windows, doors, among other products. 

David would like to continue working at his business as a way of continuing to support his family. He is asking for a loan in order to buy tools. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Cerla

texts.en:
Cerla is a 49-year-old married mother of 6 children from Concepcion, Iloilo in the Philippines. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for almost 3 years now. 

Cerla is a hardworking woman. She wishes to improve their fishing business but lacks the capital to do so. With this goal in mind, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order to gain access to loans offered to micro entrepreneurs like her.

Cerla is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, Cerla and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus providing them with more fish to sell.

In the future, Cerla hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre emprendedor de 33 años, su principal motivación para iniciar su negocio fue el desempleo, por lo que necesitaba buscar las maneras de generar ingresos para su familia.  El inició ofreciendo el servicio de video juegos por hora o fracción, luego empezó a comercializar accesorios para celulares, servicio de llamadas por minutos, golosinas, y productos de tocador. Hoy en día cuenta con una clientela fidelizada entre ellos sus vecinos, amigos, referidos y transeúntes del sector, a quienes les ofrece sus servicios diariamente en el horario de 8 a.m. a 9 p.m.  Sus compras las realiza a almacenes y a operadores de telefonía celular, estas compras las cancela de contado, pero en ocasiones no alcanza a llevar todo lo necesario para surtir el negocio por tener insuficiente capital, actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará nuevas versiones de video juegos, paquetes recargas de minutos a celulares, golosinas, talcos para cuerpo, desodorantes y colonias.  Carlos es padre de un hijo de 10 años a quien desea brindar un mejor porvenir, su meta es fortalecer mas su capital y obtener mejores resultados.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 33 year old entrepreneur.  His primary motivation for starting his business was his unemployment because he needed to find a way to earn an income for his family.  He started out offering video game services by the hour, then he starting selling cellphone accessories, prepaid minutes, snacks and toiletries.  Nowadays, he has a loyal customer base that includes his neighbors, friends, referrals and passerby in the region to whom he offers his services on a daily basis from 8am to 9pm.  

He purchases his merchandise in stores and from cellphone service providers.  He makes his purchases in cash but sometimes he does not have enough to make the necessary purchases to stock his business, which is why he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, he plans to purchase new versions of video games, prepaid cellphone minutes, snacks, body powders, deodorants and colognes.  Carlos is the father of a 10 year old for whom he hopes to provide a better future.  His goal is to further strengthen his capital and improve his business's performance.

loans.use: purchase new versions of video hames, prepaid cellphone minutes, snacks, body powders, deodorants and colognes.

loans.name: Chay

texts.en: A villager in Kampot province, Chay is 46 years old and a mother of three children, two of whom are in university. She can earn income to support her family via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. For Chay, this is her second cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her entire loan to pay the tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree in university. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree in university.

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en:
Sofya is an experienced farmer from Vedi town in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband two sons and retired mother-in-law.
 
She is self-employed in her agribusiness. Sofya, with the help of her family,  keeps livestock of two calves, hens and turkeys and cultivates tomatoes as the only source of her family’s income. Sofya's husband and son help her by selling the tomatoes in the local market. 

To continue the cultivation of the tomatoes, the family needs to invest some financial resources. They particularly need a loan of USD 2,500 to pay for forage for feeding the livestock, special forage for hens and renovation of the barn. As this is Sofya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Sofya and her hardworking family will be grateful to the lenders for helping them to collect the loan amount, which will greatly impact their agribusiness and their lives in general.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock, special forage for hens and renovation of the barn.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 23 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta 7° grado de educación básica, dejo la escuela para trabajar y apoyar económicamente a su familia, vive con su madre, una hermana y dos hermanos menores que están estudiando.

José es jornalero, recibe un pago por día trabajado en distintas actividades agrícolas, cosa que agradece a su padre que fue quien le enseñó, además es agricultor de granos básicos como maíz y frijol. También cría ganado con su padre, esto le deja buenos ingresos económicos. Por la mañana  se levanta a las 5:00 am para ir a trabajar, al terminar la jornada a las 2:00 pm se dirige a sus cultivos y trabaja el resto de la tarde. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos terneras que espera sean buenas productoras de leche en el futuro para bien de su familia.José no descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando, comprar más ganado para mejorar su producción de leche, espera construir su casa y casarse para formar su propia familia.
texts.en: Jose is 23 years old, and is single with no children. He went to school as far as the 7th grade, but then left school in order to work and support his family. He lives with his mother, a sister and two young brothers who are in school. Jose is a laborer. He is paid each day for working in different agricultural activities. He is grateful to his father for having taught him this work. He is also a farmer, growing basic grains such as corn and beans. He also raises cattle with his father, which provides him with good income. He gets up at 5:00 in the morning to go to work. When he finishes work at 2:00 pm he goes to work in his own fields for the rest of the day. The loan will be used to buy two calves, which he hopes will be good milk producers in the future in order to benefit his family. Jose is not ruling out the possibility of going back to school. He wants to buy more cows in order to increase his milk production. He hopes to build his own house, get married, and start a family.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ahmed joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Obadiya, Saminu and Isuhu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ahmed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ahmed  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rabi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Suleman, Salim and Lami.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rabi used to have to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rabi  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Salamatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Ruben, Alhamdu and Ladi.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Salamatu  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hauwa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Adamu, Safiya and Yunusa. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hauwa spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Amina joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her child,Binta.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Amina would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amina can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Amina  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her child, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniform thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

texts.en:
Alh. Hussaini is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alh. Hussaini joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Abubakar, Ali and Nusaiba.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Hussaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Hussaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Alh. Hussaini  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bitrus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mercy, Zainab and Alpa. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Bitrus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is a maize farmer from Danju Gubuchi village in Kaduna state, Nigeria. 

In the past, because he needed to pay his pressing expenses, Nura would typically have sold his maize soon after harvest, but when prices were lowest.  However, now that he is a member of Babban Gona, with their support and this loan, Nura can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more.  

Nura, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to buy food and clothing for his family. He hopes to one day become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: San Martin De Yanahuara Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE YANAHUARA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Casimiro tiene 51 años de edad es casado y tiene 02 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la carpintería, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio elabora camas, reposteros, comodas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "San Martin de Yanahuara" which is located in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. 51-year-old member, Casimiro, is married and has two children. He alternates between daily work activities as a carpenter. He's owned his business for a while and it's going well thanks to the effort that he puts into it every day. He makes beds, cabinets and dressers, among other things for all of his customers that ask him to. He wants to be able to keep working doing these kinds of things to continue supporting his family. This member is asking for a loan to buy wood. He is grateful for the loan given and he promises to pay back the monthly quotas. 

The woman in the separate photo attached asked permission to arrive late to the meeting as she had to work.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Safarkhon

texts.ru: Сафархону 61 год, он по специальности инженер-механик и сейчас находится на пенсии. Сафархон является отцом пятерых детей. Он живет в городе Душанбе с женой, дочерью, двумя сыновьями и внуком. Двое старших сыновей обзаведены семьями и живут отдельно. Единственная дочь Сафархона разведена, у нее один сын, вместе с которым она живет у родителей. Этот внук Сафархона студент, он учится во втором курсе Российско-Таджикского (славянского) Университета по специальности экономика. В данный момент его мать не в состоянии оплатить за учебу сына в ВУЗе. Сафархон видит успехи внука в учебе и хочет ему помочь. Он берет кредит, чтобы оплатить за его годовой контракт, который составляет 4500 TJS. На остальную сумму Сафархон купит ему учебные принадлежности. Сафархон надеется на Вас. Поддержите его!
texts.en: Safarkhon is 61 years old. He is a retired mechanical engineer. Safarkhon has five children. He lives in Dushanbe with his wife, daughter, two sons, and a grandson. The two older sons have their own families and live on their own. Safarkhon only daughter is divorced. She has one son who lives with her and her parents. This grandson is a student. He is a sophomore in economics at Russian-Tajik Slavic University. Now his mother is unable to pay her son's tuition. Safarkhon sees his grandson's potential for success and wants to help him. He is taking out a loan to pay for his tuition for the year, which is 4500 TJS. With the rest of the money (500 TJS), Safarkhon will buy school supplies. Safarkhon is placing is hopes in you. Support him!

loans.use: pay his grandson's university tuition and other educational expenses.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Мужчину на фотографии зовут Чурабек. Ему 37 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. Его жена домохозяйка, она следит за порядком дома и за детьми. Дети ученики средней общеобразовательной школы. Чурабек единственный кормилец в семье. Он работает водителем маршрутного такси на линии город Худжанд-город Душанбе. Чурабек каждый день с раннего утра выходит на автостоянку в ожидании клиентов. От Душанбе до Худжанда 6 часов, но зимой почти 7 часов дороги. Чурабек уже второй год работает этой сфере деятельности. Он привык такому образу жизни и ему не остается ничего иного как привыкать, потому что такси его единственная работа. 
   Причина обращения Чурабека за кредитом является покупка нового автомобиля. Он решил сменить авто, чтобы добираться до назначенного пункта быстрее и гарантировать своим клиентам скорость. Так как не достаточно средств для совершения покупки, он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
The man in the photo is named Jurabek. He is 37 years old. He is married with children. His wife is a housewife. She keeps order at home and cares for the children. The children are students in secondary school. Jurabek is the only one in the family bringing in income. He works driving a route taxi along the Khujand-Dushanbe line. Every day, staring early in the morning, Jurabek can be found in the parking lot waiting for customers. The drive from Dushanbe to Khujand takes about six hours, but in the winter it's almost seven. Jurabek is in his second year doing this work. He is used to this way of life. In fact, he had no choice but to get used to it since it's the only work he can get.

Jurabek needs a loan to buy a new car. He decided to get a new car that's faster and will ensure his customers arrive speedily. He doesn't have enough money to by a new car, so he applied for a loan.

loans.use: buy a car and improve the service he provides.

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Марина, 40 лет, замужем, есть сын - школьник. У Марины среднее образование. С 1998 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. Также работает посудомойщицей в кафе. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. В хозяйстве Марины есть 3 коровы, 10 овец. Также земельный надел мерою 1,23 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль Марины составляет 10,000 сом(KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 130,000 сом(KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Марина направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что позволит в будущем построить сарай для содержания скота.
texts.en: Marina is 40 years old, married and has a young son. Marina has a secondary education. Since 1998, she has practiced livestock breeding and crop farming. She is an expert at her trade. She also works as a dish washer at a café. Her entire family helps her with her farm. Marina has 3 cows and 10 sheep on her farm. She also has a 1.23 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans. Marina's average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). To increase the size of her herd, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 130,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. She plans to use the income from the loan to further develop her business, which will allow her to build a barn for housing her cattle in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 48 years old, married, and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. Marietta has been in this business for four years.

In the future Marietta would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda works hard to support her family. She is married and lives in the Philippines, where she has been running her food vending business for 8 years now.

Leonarda has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, margarine, etc. to make the items she sells. 

Leonarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, eggs, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat would like to take a further loan to buy mobile phone cards to sell in her shop. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loans, which enabled Phat to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Phat hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that, with this loan, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity and variety of mobile phone cards.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 23-year-old single lady who has been working as an accountant in a company since November 2013 to support her family in covering most of their necessary living needs.

Maya is a hard worker, with a very good reputation in her region. Most of her neighbors and co-workers talk about her hard work and the efforts she puts in to develop her family's living.

Today, Maya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school tuition fees and to support her family with the necessary living expenses.

She hopes that in the future she can establish her own business and develop her family's living properly.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees, and to support her family with the necessary living expenses

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia Eusebia pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 46 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada da a su negocio, la socia vende zanahorias, papas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de zanahorias entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Eusebia is a member of the communal bank "Sayhua de Chichubamba" which is located in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. She is 46 years old, single and has two children. She alternates her daily work activities selling vegetables. She's done this for quite a while and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She sells carrots and potatoes, among other things that her customers ask for. She would like to be able to keep doing this so as to keep supporting her family. This member is asking for a loan to buy carrots, among other things. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back on the established terms.

loans.use: to buy carrots, among other things.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy a range of new products with which to restock her general store. She plans to include products such as eggs, fast food, noodles, sugar, soft drinks, and milk. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of food, such as eggs, fast food, noodles, sugar, soft drinks, and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and repair parts for his electrician's workshop

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru:
Махфират заботливая мать двух детей. Сыну 13 лет, он учится в школе. А дочери 20 лет и она является студенткой третьего курса Педагогического университета Таджикистана. Махфират одна воспитывает своих детей и прилагает все усилия, чтобы они не испытывали нужду. В течение 20 лет Махфират работала в военной сфере и сейчас ей 50 лет и она находится на пенсии. Однако Махфират привыкла всю жизнь сама зарабатывать и обеспечивать семью. Поэтому после выхода на пенсию она начала у себя дома предоставлять за плату обучение русскому языку. У нее высшее образование и очень грамотный русский язык. Махфират занимается репетиторством уже 5 лет. 
В данный момент Махфират нуждается в заемных средствах. Ей необходимо оплатить за годовое обучение дочери в ВУЗе. В этом году она не смогла накопить сбережений и поэтому обратилась за кредитом. Она очень хочет, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование, который поможет им в будущем найти достойную работу.
texts.en:
Makhfirat is the caring mother of two children. Her son is 13 years old. He goes to school. Her daughter is 20 years old, and she is a third-year student at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. Makhfirat is doing her best to raise her children so that they are never in need. For 20 years Makhfirat worked for the military and now she is 50 years old and retired. However, Makhfirat has, her entire life, supported herself and her family, so she is used to it. Therefore, after retirement she started teaching Russian language at home. She has a higher education and is very competent in the Russian language. Makhfirat has been tutoring for 5 years.

Now, Makhfirat needs to borrow money. She needs to pay for her daughter's university tuition. This year she was unable save any money, and therefore requested a loan. She really wants her children to get a higher education, which will help them find a decent job in the future.

loans.use: pay her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines.

She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials and maintenance for her internet cafe business. Gemma has been in this business for 1 year now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and maintenance for her internet cafe business

loans.name: Nuria Elizabeth

texts.es: Nuria de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su madre, ella posee desde hace 10 años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nuria is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her three children and her mother. She has had a store located in her home for 10  years. She sells a variety of products such as candy, refreshments, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc. and she has many customers for her good prices. She is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale as the store is her only source of income and in this way she will be able to have greater earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, refreshments, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es:
El socio Antenor pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Antenor tiene 62 años de edad es tiene 03 hijos y es viudo, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose a la agricultura, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Antenor belongs to the “Sayhua de Chichubamba” communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Antenor is a 62-year-old widower with three children. He makes a living from agriculture. He has had this business for a while and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his business every day. He wants to be able to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family.

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase compost and seeds.

He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds

loans.name: Osmon

texts.ru: Осмон, 54 года, женат, воспитывает 3 детей. У Осмона среднее образование, на протяжении 35 лет он занимается  животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади. На участке мерою 0,8 Га собственной и 0,4 Га арендованной земли он выращивает клевер и кукурузу. Также занимается предоставлением плотницких услуг, изготавливает двери на заказ. Благодаря упорному труду Осмона, его ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в ремонт сарая.
texts.en: Osmon is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children. Osmon has a secondary education. For the last 35 years, he has farmed. His farm has two milk cows and two horses. He rents .8 hectares and 0.4 hectares of private land where he grows corn and clover. He also works as a carpenter making custom-made doors. Osmon's hard work brings in a monthly income of about 15,000 KGS. In order to further develop his business, he turned to the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 150,000 KGS to increase his livestock. He plans to spend the profit from the loan on repairing his shed.

loans.use: buy livestock to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old and married. She has five children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF.
