She will use the loan to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, spices, soap, shampoo, etc. Vilma has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, spices, soap, shampoo, and the like.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.ru: Рашид, 27 лет, не женат, детей нет. У Рашида неоконченное высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода, он занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. На участке мерою 2,0 Га он выращивает клевер. Ежемесячная прибыль Рашида составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота и закупку семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита Рашид планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит увеличить доходы его семьи и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Rashid is 27 years old, single, and has no children. Rashid has some college and supports himself farming. His farm has two cows and ten sheep. He grows clover on a two-hectare plot of land. His monthly income is about 20,000 KGS. He asked Bai -Tushum for a loan of 100,000 KGS to increase his number of livestock and to buy seed potatoes. Rashid plans to invest profits earned from the loan into repairing his home and expanding his livestock to increase his income.

loans.use: purchase livestock and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling feed in the Philippines.

She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell. Gilda has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is requesting a new loan to buy food and beverages for her food stall. Minh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages for her food stall

loans.name: Bara'u

texts.en:
Bara'u is a maize farmer from Dallami village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bara'u would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bara'u can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Bara'u, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Trong

texts.en:
Trong is 58 years old and is widowed. She has three children. She has been running a general store in front of her house.

She started this business eight years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items, to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages. She will use these to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income, to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy foods, beverages, and other products to restock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 54, is divorced and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City where she earns an income running a cafe in front of her house. 

Lan started her business 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to cover the cost to repair her shop and buy new furniture, which she hopes will attract more customers.

Lan hopes her business will continue to run smoothly and generate a higher income so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to both buy new shop furniture and repair her shop.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrahim is looking to earn a better income, to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
La señora María Juana de 57  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de baleadas,  vive en una comunidad de  San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña María Juana está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como harina, frijoles, queso, huevos, aceite, leña, etc. Para elaborar su producto el cual tiene mucha demanda, espera que con el apoyo de este préstamo sus ventas mejoren y obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia. 
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. María Juana is 57 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and children. For the past 10 years, she has managed her business of selling “baleadas” (Honduran burritos). María Juana lives in a community in San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman who has the drive to get ahead, so she strives each day to improve her quality of life.

Doña María Juana is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, beans, cheese, eggs, oil, firewood, and other items for making her product, which is in great demand. With the help of this loan, she hopes that her sales will improve so that she can obtain the necessary income to help her family get ahead.

Her dream is to have a good business. At the same, she hopes the future improves for herself and her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, cheese, eggs, oil, firewood, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фирузе 31 год. Она проживает на районе Шахритус. Она замужем и растет четверых детей. Фируза пережила большую трагедию в жизни. Она развелась с мужем с одним малолетним ребенком на руках. Период развода для нее, как и для любого человека далось нелегко. Но на ее пути появился мужчина, который помог ей и финансово и морально встать на ноги. Он принял ее ребенка и стал для нее мужем. Муж тоже пережил много невзгод  в жизни. Его жена скончалась, оставив его с двумя детьми. Фируза в ответ приняла их и отдала им всю свою материнскую любовь.  Сейчас у Фирузы и ее мужа в общем четверо детей (один общий).  Один из сыновей находиться за приделами страны на заработках, второй служит в армии.
   Фируза и ее муж имеют общую работу. Они занимаются ремонтом автомашин. Ее муж ремонтирует, выполняет самую тяжелую работу. Фируза после работы мужа выбирает подходящую краску и окрашивает автомобили. Фируза с мужем заняты этим видом бизнеса уже 2 года. 
   Причина, по которой Фируза обратилась за кредитом, является расширения бизнеса. Она хочет на заемные деньги купить рабочие инструменты, а также материалы  краски.  С полной комплектации инструментов она создаст себе хорошие условия работы и будет Вам благодарна за помощь. Вы сейчас можете поддержать ее!
texts.en:
Firuza is 31 years old. She lives in the Shahrituz District. She is married and has four children. Firuza survived a huge tragedy in her life. She divorced her husband when she had one tiny child to take care. Going through a divorce for her, like for any other person, was not easy. However, a man came into her life who helped her financially and emotionally get back on her feet. He accepted her child and became her husband. Her husband also survived many hardships in his life. His wife died and left him with two children. Firuza accepted them as her own, as well, and gave them all of her motherly love. Now Firuza and her husband has four children in total (one they had together). One of their sons is working abroad, another is serving in the army.

Firuza and her husband have a joint business. They do car repairs and renovations. Her husband repairs the cars and does all of the hard labor. After her husband finishes his work, Firuza picks out a fitting paint color and paints the cars. Firuza and her husband have been in this field of work for the past 2 years.

The reason why Firuza requested a loan is for the expansion of their business. She wants to use the lent money to buy auto mechanic tools and painting materials. With a complete tool kit, she will be able to prepare good working conditions for herself. She will be thankful to you for your help. You can support her now!

loans.use: to buy auto mechanic's tools and painting supplies.

loans.name: Danh

texts.en: Danh would like to take a further loan to buy a larger stock of products for selling at her store. Danh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of products for selling.

loans.name: Rachale

texts.en:
Rachale works hard to support her family. Rachale is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rachale has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Rachale would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is 35 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Melona has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 44 years old and married with six children.  She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.  Nena has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan.

She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from prepaid mobile load (prepaid mobile phone credits). Nena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Gladis Elena

texts.es:
Gladis una humilde mujer, escasa de recursos pero feliz que se dedica a prestar servicios de salón de belleza a domicilio pues no tiene un local ni  los implementos suficientes para montar uno.
Es madre de 2 hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad, por los cuales se preocupa mucho, al tener que pagarles la matricula, comprar su uniforme escolar, sus útiles escolares, darles si quiera una moneda para que gasten en el recreo, pero con su perseverancia ha logrado suplir todas estas necesidades.
Con la ayuda de un crédito busca comprar un secador, capas, y lava-cabezas, que son implementos que necesita.
Estos artículos le podrán ayudar a mejorar sus clientes, incrementar sus ganancias y seguir constituyéndose como una buena opción a la hora de arreglar el cabello.
Su sueño es enfocado en sus hijos quiere lo mejor para ellos y se siente realmente feliz al verlos despertar y sonreír porque tienen una comida y una madre que siempre luchara por ellos.
texts.en:
Gladis is a humble woman of few resources but happy. She has a beauty salon in her home as she doesn't have the location or sufficient tools to open a full salon. She is the mother of two children ages 13 and 10. She worries about them a lot, about having to pay their school tuition, buy their school uniform, their school supplies, and she would like to give them money for recreation. But with her perseverance she has been able to supply all their necessities.

With the help of a loan she wants to buy a hair dryer, capes, and a hair-washing sink, which are items that she needs. These items will help her improve her service to her clients, increase her earnings and continue being a good option at the point someone needs hair services. Her dream is to focus on her children as she wants the best for them and she feels happy to see them wake up and smile because they have food and a mother who will always fight for them.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, capes, and a hair-washing sink, which are items that she needs.

loans.name: Ana Rita

texts.es:
Ana una mujer de 56 años de edad, que encontró en la venta de mercancía pro catalogo un apoyo para afrontar los problemas económicos que sustentas los hogares colombianos a diario, la falta de experiencia y de estudio le cerraron las puertas en un trabajo y gracias a este negocio ha logrado generar el sustento en su hogar.
Con la ayuda de un crédito quiere comprar variedad de mercancía que se encuentra en promoción, su idea es que comprándola directamente y vendiéndola a precio que aparece en el catálogo, lograra sacarle gran provecho y mejor utilidad.
Comprará Perfumes y ropa, apóyala dale la mano, no le cierres otra puerta, está mujer quiere prosperar y demostrar que es muy útil
texts.en:
Ana is a 56-year-old woman who found, in selling merchandise by catalog, a support to face the economic problems that Colombian households bear daily. Lack of experience and schooling shut the doors to a job on her, and thanks to this business she has managed to generate sustenance in her household. 

With the help of a loan, she wants to purchase a variety of merchandise which is on sale, her idea is that by buying it directly and selling it at the price listed in the catalog, she will manage to make the most of it and get a better utility. 

She will purchase perfume and clothing.  Support her and give her a hand, don't close another door on her. This woman wants to prosper and show that she is very useful!

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as perfume and clothing.

loans.name: Maria Edilma

texts.es:
Ella es María una dedicada, humilde, honrada confeccionista, madre cabeza de familia de una hija que ya cumple 18 años de edad.
María confecciona su propia línea de ropa e inicio con su negocio en el año 2008, aprendiendo por iniciativa propia y aprovechando la experiencia que obtuvo en empresas similares.
María en su negocio se ha trazado un propósito a 5 años, generar empleo, crear un red de mujeres cabeza de familia y juntas consolidar su empresa en el mercado.
María es muy trabajadora, su horario, va desde 10 1 14 horas diarias y ahora que llego diciembre mes que es la temporada más alta, pedirá un apoyo crediticio para la compra de insumos, telas con lo que realizara camisas, camisetas y blusas.
texts.en: María is a dedicated, humble, honored seamstress. She is the female head of the household and has an 18 year old daughter. Maria makes her own line of clothing and she began her business in 2008, learning on her own initiative and taking advantage of the experience she gained in similar businesses. Maria has had a plan for 5 years to generate employment, create a network for female heads of households, and together consolidate her business in the market. Maria is very hard-working. she works 10-14 hours daily and now that December is her it is high season. She will ask for a loan to buy items such as fabric and thread so she can make t-shirts, shirts, and blouses.

loans.use: to buy items such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Saroem, 55, lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has seven children in total: three are single and four are married.

To make a living and support her family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland by growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers and customers in the market. On average, she is able to make an income of 3 USD a day. So far she has been a farmer for thirty years. 

To accelerate her farming process, she wants to buy cows to help in plowing the land and carrying the many heavy farming materials. Because there is insufficient money, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy the cows. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can help her to process her farming faster.

She is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José es un hombre de 24 años de edad que se gana la vida con el cultivo de hortalizas y verduras, actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años, pero además de cultivarlas el mismo las distribuye en un mercado municipal obteniendo mejores ingresos. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos uno de 4 años y el otro de 6 meses de edad. José desea seguir con el cultivo y venta de sus productos pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria para realizar una inversión, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: semillas, abono y alambre para levantar las parras de güisquil.
texts.en:
José is a 24-year-old man who earns his living by cultivating vegetables and greens. He has been doing this since he was 20 years old. In addition to cultivating his crops, he sells them at the municipal market in order to generate a better income. José resides in his own home along with his life companion and their two children, ages 4 and 6 months.

José wants to continue cultivating and selling his products, but he does not have the needed financial liquidity to make this investment. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in seeds, compost, and wire for building trellises on which chayote squash vines can climb.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and wire for building trellises.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 44 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada da a su negocio, la socia vende zanahorias, papas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solcitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the communal bank SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA. The bank is located in the small town of Urubamba as well as in the city of Cusco.

Matha is 44 years old, and is single with 2 children. She does her daily activities and has a business selling vegetables. She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well thanks to the determined effort she puts towards her business everyday. She sells carrots and potatoes to her customers, among other things. Martha wants to keep working to be able to continue to support her family.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy carrots at wholesale.

Martha is thankful for the loan and promises to fulfill her established loan payments.

loans.use: to buy carrots at wholesale.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 52 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, coffee, etc. to sell.

Flordeliz has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
Con la ayuda de su hermana María una mujer de 33 años de edad logro montar una distribuidora donde vende a emprendedores y tiendas, su fuerza de venta radica en la comercialización de malteadas, suplementos vitamínicos y te.
Con la ayuda de un crédito María busca realizar un pedido a gran escala a su proveedor comprando productos malteadas, suplementos vitamínicos y te con la idea de que quiere aprovechar este tiempo en el cual las personas están tomando el gimnasio muy enserio y tratar de sacar el mayor provecho al asunto.
Los mayores beneficiados serán sus hijos de 13, 10, 6 años de edad quienes podrán gozar de una navidad y quizás un regalo de santa Claus, por ello apoya a esta empresaria y has que tenga una feliz navidad.
texts.en:
With the help of her sister, María (a 33-year-old woman) managed to open a distribution center where she sells to entrepreneurs and stores. Her sales strength comes from selling malted products, vitamin supplements, and tea.

With the help of a loan, María wants to make a large scale order from her provider, purchasing malted products, vitamin supplements, and tea, with the idea of taking advantage of this time when people are taking the gym very seriously and trying to get the most out of this. 

The greatest beneficiaries will be her children, ages 13, 10 and 6 who will be able to enjoy Christmas and perhaps a gift from Santa Claus. For this, support this entrepreneur and make her have a Merry Christmas.

loans.use: to purchase malted products, vitamin supplements, and tea.

loans.name: Yaritza Stefany

texts.es:
Yaritza es una joven madre cabeza de familia, que a sus 18 años carga con la responsabilidad de alimentar a su hijo y brindarle todo ejerciendo como madre y padre.
Se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas lo cual lo hace sacando un puesto de alimentos al frente de su hogar, con ello puede generar ingresos para comprar todo lo que necesita para su bebe que tan solo tiene 20 días de nacido.
Su niño le ha generado grandes gastos dejándola sin con que invertir en su negocio por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de víveres, empaques, frutas, verduras, carnes para su negocio.
Apoya a esta madre cabeza de familia que hace hasta lo imposible para mantener a su bebe
texts.en:
Yaritza is a young female head of household, who at 18 years old is responsible for feeding her son and offering him everything, acting both as mother and father. 

She works selling fast food which she does by setting up a food stall in front of her home. With it, she can generate income to purchase everything that is necessary for her baby who is only 20 days old.

Her son has generated a lot of expenses leaving her without anything to invest in her business. For this, she asks for a loan to purchase supplies, packaging, fruits, vegetables, and meat for her business. 

Support this female head of the family who even does the impossible to support her baby.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, packaging, fruit, vegetables, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Doralba

texts.es:
Doralba es una empresaria con visión y con ánimos de progresar que encontró en su negocio de tienda general donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar, una oportunidad para generar el sustento a sus 3 hijos.
Doralba buscando mejorar sus ingresos pues quiere darles estudios universitarios a todos sus hijos quiere un apoyo para la compra de bultos de cemento, e iniciar con la comercialización de este producto tan usado en la construcción.
 Este crédito le permitirá comenzar a comercialización un nuevo producto para ella y tratar de conseguir los recursos para darles la oportunidad a sus hijos de acceder a estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Doralba is a businesswoman with vision and energy for making progress. In her general store business, where she sells everyday household staples, Doralba has found an opportunity to earn a living for her three children.

Looking to improve her income because she wants to give all her children a university education, Doralba would like some help in order to purchase sacks of cement. Then she can start selling this product, which is so often used in construction.

This loan will allow her to start marketing a new product and trying to get the resources to give her children the opportunity to access higher education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cement and start putting this product on the market

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 56-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a buy and sell seafoods business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of seafood to sell.

Gina has been in this business for eight years.  In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of seafood to sell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана, 48 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она 20 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Светланы есть 2,40 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает люцерну для реализации. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет до 40,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Svetlana is 48 years old, married and a mother to 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, she started a livestock breeding and crop farming business 20 years ago. Svetlana owns a 2.40 hectare plot of land on which she grows alfalfa for sale. Her average cumulative monthly income is 40,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 150,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. She plans to invest the earnings the loan to further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand her business.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn

texts.en:
Bunthoeurn, 35, is a married man from Kampong Speu Province. He has two children, who are currently in school. He has been a doctor for seven years, and earns $10.00 a day. His wife, Mom, 32, is a masseuse and earns $3.00 a day. 

Recently, some parts of his house have deteriorated, and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, Bunthoeurn has applied for a KIVA loan via HKL to pay for his house renovation. He and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for his house renovation

loans.name: Nubia Orbelina

texts.es:
La señora  Nubia  de 27 años de edad,  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella y su de esposo vive en casa de un familiar en una comunidad de san Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace 02 años  al negocio de venta de tortillas y tamales.
Doña Nubia también actualmente vende  ropa nueva y usada los cual le genera otros ingresos, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan en  su casa y también sale a vender de forma ambulante por las aldeas y caseríos aledaños a su comunidad.
Doña Nubia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal, para seguir elaborando su producto de tortillas con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio mandara a sus hijos a la escuela. Está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Nubia is 27 years old and has two dependent children. She and her husband live in the family home in the community of San Lorenzo, Valle, which is in southern Honduras. Nubia has been selling tortillas and tamales for two years.

Doña Nubia also sells new and used clothing in order to generate extra income. Her customers include friends and people who visit her each day at her house. She also makes traveling sales by going to the neighborhoods and villages that surround her community.

Doña Nubia is requesting this loan in order to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder so that she can continue producing tortillas. With the help of this loan, she expects to improve her earnings and eventually her quality of life. Nubia will use her business profits to send her children to school. She is very pleased to continue working with Prisma. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: Jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el posee un bazar ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia donde vende una variedad de productos como hilo, medicinas, juguetes, golosinas, etc. tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jose is 48 years old and lives in his own home along with his three children. He has a bazaar that is located near his place of residence. Jose sells a variety of products such as thread, medicines, toys, snack foods, and other items. He has many customers because of the variety of products.

Jose is requesting a loan in order to buy more products in bulk so that he can continue his sales.

loans.use: to buy thread, medicines, toys, snack foods, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba, es una madre de 47 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos y con un futuro en el negocio de las flores por delante.
Aprendió acerca del cultivo y comercialización de flores gracias a que estuvo trabajando en un establecimiento similar y desde el año 2010 tomo la decisión de emprenderse por su propio rumbo.
A lo largo de los 4 años que lleva operando ha tenido dificultades, montar un negocio no es para nada fácil, requiere de mucho sacrificio y capital, este último no lo tiene por ello quiere apoyarse en la alianza Kiva-Interactuar, buscando un apoyo para comprar abonos, riegos, y algunos exterminadores de plagas, pero la razón central es para comprar una cartera en bancamia que es uan entidad que da muchas oportunidades y brinda gran apoyo a los agricultores.
texts.en:
Rosalba, is a 47-year-old woman, mother of 4 children, and with a future in the floral business ahead of her. 

She learned about cultivating and selling flowers thanks to having worked in a similar establishment and in 2010 decided to undertake her own path. 

During the 4 years that she has been operating, she has had difficulties. Starting a business isn't easy at all, it requires a lot of sacrifice and capital, the latter which she doesn't have. For this reason, she wants to help herself with the Kiva-Interactuar alliance, looking for support to purchase manure, irrigation and some pesticides, but the primary reason is to purchase a portfolio in Bancamía which is an entity that gives many opportunities and offers great support to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase manure, irrigation, and some pesticides.

loans.name: Elkin Dario

texts.es:
Elkin de 38 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos todos ellos menores de edad, dedicado a la cría de ganado bovino, en pocas palabras en productos de leche, este humilde, y penoso hombre que para la foto quiso ponerse su mejor vestimenta quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una mula de carga, su idea es tener como transportar sus cargamentos de leche.
Elkin le urge bastante este préstamo el deterioro de la vía y los difíciles caminos montañosos hace casi imposible el transporte de leche y de esta actividad depende su familia.
texts.en:
Elkin, 38 years old, is father to 3 children, all of whom are minors, works raising cattle or, in short, in dairy products. This humble and shy man who, for the photo, wanted to put on his best clothing, wants to ask for a loan to purchase a pack mule. His idea is to have it to transport his loads of milk.

The deterioration of the routes and the difficult mountain roads which make it almost impossible to transport the milk pressure Elkin to get this loan, and his family depends on this work.

loans.use: to purchase a pack mule.

loans.name: Alh. Abdulrazak

texts.en: Alh. Abdulrazak is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alh. Abdulrazak joined Babban Gona, primarily to create a better future for his children: Muhammed, Abubakar, and Yahaya.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Abdulrazak would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Abdulrazak can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Alh. Abdulrazak spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. He hopes eventually to ensure that his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms for his children, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cream, lip liner, and perfume.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc. for her furniture making business.

Hazel has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from a general store.

Hazel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piñata products, disposable tableware, and plastic items

loans.name: Kelly Maximiliana

texts.es:
Kelly es una señorita de 19 años de edad, actualmente vende en una carreta ambulatoria jugo de naranja, chicha morada, cebada (refrescos), ubicado en un lugar céntrico su anhelo es ahorrar un pequeño capital con las ventas de estos refrescos  para poder estudiar una carrera superior y de esta manera darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres.
Kelly en los meses de noviembre y diciembre aprovecha vender panetones y adornos navideños con motivo de la festividad navideña; con estos ingresos apoya a sus padres; por ello el crédito lo necesita para la compra de panetones, adornos navideños.
Kelly esta muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido de los inversionistas kiva.
texts.en:
Kelly is a 19-year-old young lady. From a movable cart, she sells orange juice, chicha morada (a corn-based juice with pineapple, cloves, and cinnamon), and a barley drink. She sells from a central area. Her wish is to save up a bit of capital from her sales in order to study for a higher-level career in order to give her parents a better quality of life.
In the months of November and December, Kelly sells Christmas cakes and decorations for the Christmas season. With this income, she supports her parents. She needs a loan to buy Christmas cakes and decorations.
Kelly is very grateful for the support of the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy Christmas cakes and decorations.

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es: Otoniel de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Otoniel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Otoniel is 33 years old and resides in his own home along with his three children. He grows corn and sorghum and then sells his products at different markets that are located near his house.

Otoniel is requesting a loan so that he can buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies for improving the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, he can continue his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies for improving his land.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Marie. She is widowed and has four children, aged 22, 17, 14 and 11 years; three are school-going children. In 2004, Marie established her foodstuff —  tinned tomatoes, rice, vegetable oil, flour, Maggi, etc. — business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 743,730 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Marie has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buys bags of rice, sugar, cornmeal, and salt. In the future, Marie plans to expand the business and purchase a piece of land. She was unable to buy land as planned, but invested in the business. Her major challenge is the increase of the price of commodities and transportation costs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff like rice, sugar, cornmeal, salt, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. Daisy is a widow and has a buying and selling of recycled materials business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of recycled materials.

Daisy has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of recycled materials

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Inusa, Zaka and Sadik. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Samaila spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Chi's Group

texts.en:
Chi is single, 49, and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past 15 years, Chi has been running a store selling rice from the front of her house. 

She is the group leader of a seven-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is the first from right wearing a spotted blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. 

Chi is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of rice to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell rice from her store.

loans.name: Sallau

texts.en:
Sallau is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sallau would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sallau can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Sallau is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan that he was awarded. The previous loan was used to purchase a spray pump for his tractor and other supplies for his agricultural work of planting and harvesting land. Enver believes that, because he was able to work more effectively and efficiently, he was able to improve the living conditions of his family and to start to offer his children a better life.

He was very satisfied with the loan and the loan process and is requesting a second loan in order to purchase new agricultural tools for his tractor. He hopes that the investment in his tractor will continue to help improve his business and income. He promises to pay on time and again thanks all of the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase new agricultural tools for his tractor

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in the Kaduna state of Nigeria. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zakiru Maigugu

texts.en: Zakiru Maigugu is a maize farmer from Kankanki village in the Kaduna state of Nigeria. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zakiru Maigugu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zakiru Maigugu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Zakiru Maigugu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Confort M.

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Confort M. She is married, and has one 2-year-old child.

In 2012, Confort M. established her clothing business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns approximately 3,676,000 SLL every month from her business.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Comfort M. has already received and successfully repaid one prior loan, and is seeking this loan in order to purchase bails of clothing, such as shirts and jeans, for both men and women. In the future, Confort M. plans to seek larger loans in order to improve the business. She has not completed her house as planned because of the current satiation in her country, which affected her business in terms of sales. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to expand and improve her clothing business by purchasing bails of jeans and shirts.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga, 62, is the leader of this seven-member loan group, all of whom live in Ho Chi Minh City (in this photo she is third from the right and wearing a printed blouse). She lives with her son and husband. For the past 25 years Nga has been running a sari-sari, or general store from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family.

Nga is requesting a 97,000,000 VND loan through CEP for the members of her group. She will use her portion of the loan to restock her store with better quality and greater varieties of products such as food and beverages. The other group members will use their shares to fund income-generating activities as well.

Nga hopes restocking her store will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy detergent, shampoo, food and beverages to sell from her sari-sari.

loans.name: Rosalba Elena

texts.es:
Rosalba es una humilde mujer de 47 años de edad, dedicada al hogar, a su esposo y a sus padres, aburrida por la monotonía y con un gran talento para preparar comidas desperdiciado, decidió a principios del año 2013 comenzar a preparar alimentos para generar su propio sustento.
Rosalba quiere mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, llevar su negocio más allá de la cocina de su casa  y un día poder montar un restaurante por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de un horno, una freidora y surtido de alimentos para fabricar en mayor cantidad sus preparaciones se atreverá a salir de su cotidianidad para buscar montar su restaurante, apóyala participa en este lindo proyecto de como una mujer cansada del hogar se volvió empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosalba is a humble 47-year-old woman. She is devoted to her home, her spouse, and her parents. She is bored by the monotony of things, and is very talented at preparing food. In the beginning of 2013, she decided to start preparing food to support herself. Rosalba wants to improve her sales, increase her customer base, and take her business outside of her own kitchen and one day start a restaurant. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy an oven, a deep-fryer, and an assortment of food to make her prepared dishes in larger quantities. She will take the risk of leaving her daily routine to start a restaurant. Help her and participate in this beautiful project of how a woman tired of her home life became an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy an oven, a deep-fryer, and an assortment of food.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and is married with one child in school. Cheryl works very hard to provide for her family.

To earn a living, she operates a general store in the Philippines. Cheryl has been in this business for 3 years.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including shampoo and groceries. She would like to save enough money to provide a more secure future for her family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., shampoo and groceries) to sell

loans.name: Rexhep

texts.en:
Rexhep is 47 years old and married. He is a hardworking father who does a lot to provide his children with whatever they need. He is currently employed as a guard and is also involved in agriculture. He currently owns three cows that he tends to in order to gain dairy products for his family use and to sell in the neighborhood. His wife is also involved in agricultural work, and plants different vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes and potatoes to use for cooking and also to sell in the market. They are both satisfied with the income they earn and the manner in which they are providing for their family. 

Now, for the first time, Rexhep is requesting a loan in order to purchase another milk cow and to renovate the stable. He has a lot of demand for the milk and dairy products, and in order to satisfy his clients needs, he will need to increase his production. He appreciates the help and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow and to renovate the stable

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le is requesting a loan to expand her business, by buying a greater variety of products such as soft drinks and food to restock her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and food to sell at her store.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille works hard to support her family. Cecille is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Cecille has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Cecille would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 38, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business 15 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products for selling from her store.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Nuhu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Gidion and Faiza.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Nuhu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 42, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including her daughter and husband. Her husband supports the family by making iron doors. Hong earns money through selling many kinds of hats. She started this business ten years ago. 

Hong would like to get a loan to buy more different types of hats to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy hats for selling from her shop.

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika is a maize farmer from Doya village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mika would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mika can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Mika, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 43, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two daughters and one son.  She is divorced.

Phuong earns money through her business selling coffee. She started this shop four years ago. She would like to get a loan to buy better quality coffee to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy better quality coffee for selling from her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yusuf joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Ezekel, Musa and Maryamu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yusuf spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Wuroh

texts.en: This is thirty-year-old Wuroh. She is single. In 2011, Wuroh established her salon business. She was trained to be a hairdresser so she decided to have her own shop to make money. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Wuroh requires a loan in order to buy additional dozens of hair products like human hair, shampoo, hair cream, oil, expression hair, etc. She hopes that this loan will attract more customers and make more profit. In the future, Wuroh plans to increase her staff by at least two. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for hair products.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan, 35, is divorced and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her sons. Lan earns money through her business selling shoes. Lan is sometimes unable to provide the volume of shoes required by her customers. Consequently, she would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of shoes to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy shoes for selling from her shop.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van would like to take a further loan to buy new tools and silver to make new products. Van's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy silver and new tools to make new products.

loans.name: Xi

texts.en: Xi would like to take a further loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell from her shop. Xi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Usman is looking to earn a better income, to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Joy and Christopher.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Musa  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Leonor Edith

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Los Capuchinos.
En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 15 y 10 años de edad, la  mayor  estudia en colegio y la menor en escuela. El marido trabaja en una institución privada.
Doña Leonor se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. También se dedica a la cría de pollos ke le dejan muy buenos ingresos que los utiliza para la educación de sus hijas.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella y su familia. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The members of the "Los Capuchinos" communal bank meet every fortnight at the San Cristóbal citadel in the city of Portoviejo, the capital de Manabí province. It has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds for many years.

Leonor lives here. She is 44 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has two children aged 15 and 10 years old. The oldest studies in High School and the youngest at a primary school. Her husband works in a private institution.

Leonor works selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories) She works 3 days a week, leaving her products on credit and collecting every 8 days. She also works raising chickens which provides good income which she uses for her daughters' education.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, cream and cosmetics. This is her 6th loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it as the loans are of mush help to her and her family. Her dream is to provide the best for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of basic products, such as foods and beverages, to restock her store

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is 58 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

David has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. David also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that David's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Edeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Edeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of fruit business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline. Edeline is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell for her buy and sell of fruits business.

Edeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular, foods and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Tram

texts.en: Tram would like to take a further loan to buy better-quality food products to sell from her stall. Tram's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase better-quality food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Inusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Inusa is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maris Yoris

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Los Capuchinos.
En este lugar vive la señora Maris, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido tiene una fábrica de bloques.
Doña Maris se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida y bocadillos, todos los días prepara almuerzos y meriendas  pero solo para entregar bajo pedidos, ella entrega a domicilio, también prepara comida y bocadillos para fiestas y todo tipo de compromisos sociales, esto por lo general lo realiza una vez por semana, aunque por estas fechas aumenta su trabajo. Lleva  más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar  viveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Este es su primer crédito en este grupo pero ya estuvo en otro y se cambio ya que el actual está cerca de su casa le gusta porque así sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the "Los Capuchinos" communal bank meet every fortnight at the San Cristóbal citadel in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province. It has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds for many years.

Maris lives here. She is 39 years old, is married and from this relationship has two children aged 11 and 6 years old, both of whom study at school. Her husband has a cinder block factory.

Maris works preparing and selling meals and snacks but only to deliver on order. She delivers to homes and also prepares meals and snacks for parties and all sorts of social occasions. Normally she does this one time per week although at this time of year her work increases. She has been working in this business for more than 10 years where she can make her own money for the benefit of her family.

She will use this loan to buy the food needed to prepare her meals. This is her first loan with this group but she was in another communal bank and changed to this one as it is closer to her home and she likes the communal bank as she can progress. Her dream is to provide her children the best.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru:
Рачабгул 58 летняя жительница района Вахш. Ей 58 лет. У нее пятеро детей. Четыре дочки и сын. Ее сын женат и живет вместе с ней. Рачабгул с сыном и выпечкой занимаются выпечкой самбусы. Самбуса- это национальные мясные пирожки, они выпекаются в специальных кругообразных печей. Эту деятельность она продвигает уже 10 лет. Рачабгул научилась печь у своей мамы. Посей день, она благодарна своей маме. 
   Причина, по которой Рачабшул обратилась за кредитом, является незавершенный ремонт. Пришли холода и ее семье трудно поддерживать тепло в доме. Рачабгул видит только один выход из этой ситуации, это получение кредита. Она верит, что найдутся люди, которые ей помогут и поддержат. Сейчас Вы можете помочь Рачабгул.
texts.en:
Rajabgul is 58 years old and lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 58 years old and the mother of five: four daughters and one son. Her son is married and lives in the same house. Rajabgul with her son and [daughter-in-law?] work baking sambusas for sale. Sambusas are traditional meat pies baked in a special round oven. Rajabgul has been in this business for 10 years already. Rajabgul learned baking from her mother, and is grateful to her to this day.

Rajabgul has applied for a loan because of pending home renovations. The cold season has started, and it is hard for her family to maintain the house properly heated. Rajabgul sees only one option: obtaining a loan. She trusts that there will be people to help and support her. You can help Rajabgul right now.

loans.use: to renovate her home.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
As a widowed woman, Perpetua works hard for her daily needs.

She has a buy and sell of dressed chicken business in the Philippines and earns additional income from video rentals.  Perpetua is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more dressed chicken for retailing for her buy and sell of dressed chicken business.

Perpetua has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chicken to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana works hard to support her family. Ana is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ana has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jorgea

texts.en:
Jorgea is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jorgea is 55 years old.

Jorgea has a direct selling beauty and household products business in the Philippines. Jorgea requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more beauty and household products for retailing.

Jorgea has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jorgea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty and household products for retailing

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is the group leader of his group in Webuye District and he is representing 11 farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of two children. John joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, John decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who  have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

John's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of eight solar lights. Even though John decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan would like to take a further loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and beauty care products to sell from her store. Lan's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics and beauty care products to sell from her store.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en: Giau is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food, beverages and other products to restock his store

loans.name: Samaila Daniel

texts.en: Samaila Daniel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila Daniel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Habila, Yahuza and Isiya. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila Daniel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Samaila Daniel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 59, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 15 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products to sell from her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to sell from her store.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 44, is married and has four daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family by repairing old scooters. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business 10 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products to sell from her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new products such as confectionary and beverages to sell from her store.

loans.name: María Sarita

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito La Negrita se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 51 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo 4  hijos todos mayores de edad que  aun vive con ella a pesar de que ya están comprometidos.
Doña María para poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar ya que esta sola sin el respaldo de su marido hace varios años empezó un negocio, tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días y todo el día ya prepara desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, con ella  trabaja una persona a quien le paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo, tiene 7 años su comedor y  siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos lo que la hace especial.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus metas son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "La Negrita" communal bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi canton which is known for it's rich pre-colonial culture and it's handicrafts. It is known nationally and internationally as the home of the Panama hat.

María lives here. She is 51 years old. A number of years ago her husband dies but from this relationship she has 4 children. All of them are adults but still live with her in spite of being engaged.

In order to get ahead with the household expenses María given she was alone and had no support from her husband , started a business a number of years ago. She has a small eatery in her house where she prepares delicious meals. She works every day and all day preparing breakfast, lunch and dinners. She has a person working with her who she pays a wage weekly for their work. She had had the diner for 7 years and things have always gone well. The customers prefer her for her seasonings which she uses to make them special.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare her meals. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it as the loans are very helpful. Her goal is to continue to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a security guard. Tuyen runs a beauty salon to earn a living. 

She started her business 15 years ago. She intends to take a loan to repair her salon, to attract more new customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her beauty salon.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer from Hari village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Samaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, in order to reduce the operating costs on her farm, by taking advantage of her cows', hogs' and sheep's manure, to produce her own biogas and biofertilizer. She dedicates herself to fattening cows and sheep to sell their meat, and also cultivates corn and oats for her family's own consumption. 

With the biodigester, she will be able to turn her animals' waste into a precious resource, to become self-sufficient in her supply of energy and fertilizer. She will use the biogas to cook and heat water in the house, while her crops' yield will increase as she spreads the nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer on her crops. She will save money as she stops purchasing the expensive LP gas. She plans to use her savings to purchase more animals and expand the farm, as her family grows too. 

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester; the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia works hard to support her family. Anastacia is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF, to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Anastacia has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Anastacia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Pilar
