Juliet has been in this business for two years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Marta es una agricultora de 55 años de edad, que a través de un crédito busca cubrir las falencias y las pérdidas que el invierno género en su negocio. Arrasando sus cultivos hasta dejarla sin si quiera poder cubrir la cuota para volver a sembrar.
Se encuentra muy preocupada porque no solo fue su cultivo su economía, su hogar se vieron muy golpeadas y es por ella que solicita con urgencia un apoyo en un crédito que se encuentra solicitando con lo que comprara abonos, riegos, fertilizantes, larvicidas e insecticidas.
Tu apoyo significara un gran empuje para esta mujer que tiene aque atender su hogar constituido por su esposo y dos hijos y solo tiene sus flores para sostenerse.
texts.en:
Marta is a 55-year-old farmer. With this loan, she is looking to cover shortages and losses from her business that were brought on by the winter season. Her crops were destroyed to the point that she was not able to cover the cost of replanting.

Marta is very concerned because, not only was this crop her source of income, but her household was left severely devastated. For this reason, she is urgently requesting assistance through a loan. The money she is requesting will be used to pay for compost, irrigation, fertilizers, larvicides, and insecticides.

Having this assistance will be a big boost for Marta since she has to sustain her household, which includes her husband and two children. Right now, she only has flowers to support herself.

loans.use: to pay for compost, irrigation, fertilizers, larvicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria de 30 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo y sus padres, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 30-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her child and her parents. She has been selling tortillas for several years. Her business is located at her place of residence.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy corn in bulk and lime powder. As a result, she can continue her sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime powder.

loans.name: Luka Danjuma

texts.en: Luka Danjuma is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Luka Danjuma joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Timoti and Issuwa. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Luka Danjuma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Luka Danjuma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Luka Danjuma spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a cosmetics selling shop, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a food stall business, selling from home, which earns her another source of livelihood. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Rose dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of cosmetics and foodstuff for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics and foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 42 years old and two of her children are in school.

Myrna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw products and ingredients for her business.

Myrna has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw products and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married mother of five children, all of whom are grown-ups. She lives in her rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 50 years old and both of her children are in school.

Erlinda has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Koemleng's Group

texts.en: Koemleng, 47, is a mother of six children living in Prey Veng province. She can earn an income to support her family's condition via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. For Koemleng, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and pumping water. She hopes that she can improve her family's conditions so they are better than before and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and pumping water.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yakubu, Joshua and Yushau.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ayuba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and fees.

She has operated a business selling paraffin for use in cooking at retail to her neighbours. In addition, she operates a phone charging business, which earns her another source of income. She faces the challenge of delayed payments, hence low profits in her business.

With the loan of 50,000 Kes that she is requesting, she wants to establish rental houses and to purchase cement and sand for their construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: Gulzar is a 41-year-old, hardworking woman who has four children. Her husband is also shown in the photo. For the last two years, she has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Gulzar’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Currently, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces to provide a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Aminu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Baby and Baba.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Aminu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
A tempranas hora de la mañana y con una radiante sonrisa  atiende a sus clientes  Flor de  María en su  pequeño y acogedor cafetín. Este está situado en una de las universidades  de su ciudad, los estudiantes la prefieren porque su servicio  es excepcional y por la variedad en su menú. Anteriormente acudió  a financiamientos para la compra de productos de consumo para el cafetín, en la actualidad  solicita préstamo para la compra de uvas y manzanas para aprovechar la temporada de alta rotación.
El propósito mayor de Flor es  seguir trabajando para lograr un negocio con mayor rentabilidad.  Confiesa que el progreso que ha logrado conseguir  ha sido gracias a su familia,  quienes la apoyan en toda circunstancia. Entre sus planes están la solvencia inmediata de los financiamientos antes solicitados y crear un perfil crediticio  que sea de apoyo a largo plazo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Early in the morning, Flor de María serves her clients with a big smile in her small and cozy café. It is located at one of the universities of her city and students go there because of its excellent service and menu. 

She has had loans in the past to buy food products for the café and she is now requesting a loan to buy grapes and apples during the high-rotation season. Flor's main goal is to continue working to have a more profitable business. She admits that the progress she has made has been possible thanks to her family, who has always supported her. She plans to repay as soon as possible and to create a credit profile which will be beneficial for the business.

loans.use: to buy grapes and apples.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en: Humaira, a 29-year-old single woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. The man shown in the photo is her brother.  She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Humaira has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 29 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Aileen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marianella De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Diversos productos de belleza para ambos sexos son lo que ofrece Marianella de la concepción en su pequeña tienda. Empezó su negocio con sus propios ahorros,  luego a medida que la clientela se iba incrementando acudió a financiamientos y hoy en día sus ingresos se han duplicado. Además de ser proveedora, también se dedica al estilismo, de esta manera asiste a su público con recomendaciones y tips para la aplicación de sus productos. Solicita préstamos para invertir en la compra de productos tales como cremas, perfumes, shampoo, entre otros para diversificar su negocio.
Marianella posee diferentes encargos especiales dado a las fechas festivas del año. Se siente realizada por la preferencia y fidelidad  de sus clientes. Planea seguir con el comercio hasta alcanzar todas sus metas. Espera cancelar cualquier deuda pendiente y  seguir trabajando con crédito en el futuro ya que lo considera importante para el  progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marianella de la Concepción offers different beauty products for both men and women in her small store. She started the business with her savings and then requested loans as her clientele increased. Her earnings today have doubled. She is also an stylist and helps her clients with recommendations and tips to use with her products. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase products such as lotions, perfumes and shampoo, among others, so that she can diversify her business. Additionally, Marianella has special orders at this festive time of the year. 

She feels fulfilled with the loyalty and preference that clients show for her products and she plans to keep running the business until she reaches all her goals. She plans to cancel any pending debt and to keep working with loans in the future, which she thinks is a good resource.

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes and shampoo, among others.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over 15 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
Nen is 34 years old and a mother of five children who living in Kampong Cham province. Because of her family's living condition, she grows cassava on five hectares area as a single source of her income. 

For Nen, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married mother and has no children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are  household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1991 in the northern part of Tajikistan. She lives in a rural area. She is married. Her husband is an emigrant. She has one child. She worked for about five years. She sews clothes that customer’s order. She has a variety of experiences in sewing clothes. Almost all her free time she spends on working at her favorite activity. She wants to fulfill her duties for her mother. Umeda needs financial support to conduct her mother through the medical center.

loans.use: To conduct her mother through the medical center

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children. For the past five years, she has been running the business of animal sales and purchase with her husband. She looks after the animals, such as goats and calves, and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them in different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Yasmeen has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more baby goats for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats for resale purposes.

loans.name: Sokmeach's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Sokmeach is 51 years old and a mother of four schoolchildren. To support her living, she grows rice on two hectares' area and works for others for a fee to earn more income. 

This is first time for Sokmeach with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and pay for labor to harvest her rice. She hopes that she can improve her rice farm better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay for labor to harvest her rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Sreypao is 45 years old and a mother of two children. She earns income to support her living via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. 

This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue the bachelor degree majoring in Civil Engineering. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue the bachelor degree majoring in Civil Engineering.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya, 34, is a farmer who is living in Kampong Speu province and is a mother of one child. For the sake of her family, she grows rice and sells grocery items to earn more income. 

This is first time for Ya with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition for her son who wants to pursue his education at university. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her son who wants to pursue his education at university.

loans.name: Tipindule Group

texts.en:
Jessy is a married woman of 39 years old who supports her family by selling chickens in Nkhatabay district. She has five children who go school. 

She sells chickens and her husband helps her on the daily operations of the business. Before she started her market stall, she used to be a housewife. She is applying for this loan to purchase feed for her chickens.

Jessie plans to use any profit made to satisfy her family's basic needs and to diversify  her business with a grocery store. Jessie is now independent.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en:
A mother of three children living in Takeo province, Sarann is 39 years old. She can earn income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and fish-raising. Moreover, she can earn extra income via chickens and pigs-raising. 

For Sarann, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition fee for her child who wants to pursue the bachelor degree at university. She hopes that her child can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her child who wants to pursue the bachelor degree at university.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de antojitos (pastelitos de carne, yuca y papas frita, empanadas, etc.) y fresco, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, la joven vive en casa propia sus padres y su hermano, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, yuca, papas, etc. para continuar con sus ventas y asi tnr mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman's face is blurred because she is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She sells snack foods (meat, yucca and potato pies, empanadas, etc.) and soft drinks.  Her business is set up near her place of residence in a very busy area.  She lives in her own house with her parents and a brother.  The loan she is requesting is to buy meat, vegetables, yucca plant, potatoes, etc. to continue with her sales activity and to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, yucca plant, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: Lilian de 43 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 10 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en: Lillian, 43, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son.  She has been in business for ten years selling sandwiches and hamburguers.  She has many customers because of her low prices, and uses the profit she earns to cover some of the household expenses.  The loan she is requesting is to buy ingredients to make sandwiches and hamburguers, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, sausages, and other ingredients so she can earn more and continue helping with the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, sausages, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 52 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, ella vive junto a su hija y su compañero de vida en casa propia y posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 3 años, ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 52, is a very hard-working, responsible person who dedicates all her time to her business.  She lives with her daughter and common-law husband in her own house.  For three years she has been selling fruits and vegetables from home.  She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale fruit and vegetables to improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yohanna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Zina, Elijah and Atta.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yohanna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jorge Geovanny

texts.es: Jorge de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 20 años experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de vender una buena calidad de producto por esa razón posee clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que muestra en la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge, 40, lives in his own house with his wife and daughter.  For 20 years he has worked in artisan fishing which has given him the opportunity to sell a high quality product which has attracted many customers.  He is requesting a loan to buy the tools he needs to continue his work such as drag-nets and nets, and to pay for maintenance of the boat shown in the photograph.  This is his only work activity and source of income.

loans.use: To buy a drag-net and nets, and pay for boat maintenance.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en: Salisu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Salisu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ziyada, Umar and Usman.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Salisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Salisu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda, 49 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shop doing business for the past three years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Rasheeda needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Therefore, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 20,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee desde hace algunos años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young person's face is blurred because she is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area.  For several years she has been running a small store in her home where she attends to many customers because of her low prices.  She lives in her own home with her husband and daughter.  The loan she is requesting is to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to increase her income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en: Mukhtiar is a 34-year-old married woman. Her husband (the man shown in the picture) works in the construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of houses during construction. In this way, he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. So, Mukhtiar availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 20,000 to grow her husband's business. It helped her husband to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Philibus Dogara

texts.en: Philibus Dogara is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Philibus Dogara joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Istipanus, Elezebeth and Augustine.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Philibus Dogara would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philibus Dogara can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Philibus Dogara spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en: Asabe is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Asabe joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Istifanus, Yosi and Maryam.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Asabe would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Asabe can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Asabe spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of their house for the last six years. Her husband purchases goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years and then sells them in their store. Rehana is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, sugar, rice, oil, beverages, etc. to meet the increasing demand in their store. They are expecting a boost in their earnings and dream of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, sugar, rice, oil, beverages, etc. to meet the increasing demand in their store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 42-year-old married woman. The man shown in the picture is her husband. They have been successfully running a small general store at their house for many years. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. He also sells their products in other communities and Robina sells them at their house. Now they want to grow their business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of biscuits, sugar, salt, rice, beverages and other necessary grocery items to meet the regular demand in their shop. She is expecting a boost in their earnings and dreams of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, sugar, salt, rice, beverages and other necessary grocery items.

loans.name: Alh. Isiyaku

texts.en: Alh. Isiyaku is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Anas, Aminu and Ali. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Alh. Isiyaku spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Danladi, Yusuf and Murna.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Alice would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alice can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Alice spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Meena

texts.en: Meena is a 52-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. One of her sons is standing with her in the picture. Meena and her son have been successfully running a small general store at the corner of their house for two years. Her son assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market. Their business provides them enough to meet their day-to-day family expenditures. Now they want to grow their business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar, cleaning products, beverages, etc. She is expecting a boost in their earnings and dreams of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar, cleaning products, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various kinds of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is running a small general store at her home. She is trying hard to support her family. She is accountable to provide for her family. However, she faces a financial problem in the growth of her business. She needs to buy more items to fill her shop. For this, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, rice, sugar, oil and cleaning products to meet the demand of her customers time after time. She is positive about her future earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, rice, sugar, oil and cleaning products to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Yusuf Shawai

texts.en: Yusuf Shawai is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Sani, Aisha and Bala.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf Shawai would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf Shawai can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yusuf Shawai spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat   des intrants pour le maraichage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Gimo

texts.pt:
O Sr. Gimo  de 52 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos, dos quais 2  estao a frequentar a escola no ensino secundario e 3 sao independente  vive na sua propria casa. Ela è agricultora informal de produtos da machamba, actividade que esta a explorar a mais de 20 anos junto com seu filho e 1 auxiliar, culturas de feijao verde, cebola, tomate e mais diversas culturas, suas culturas vende no mercado de Boane e Maputo.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar insumos agricolas (sementes de tomate, cebola, pipino e pagamento de lauvora da machamba.)
Tem como grande desafio aumentar a sua produtividade das suas culturas para garantir a sua reforma e a sustentabilidade da sua familia.
texts.en:
Gimo is a 52 year old, married father of 5 children: 2 of whom attend secondary school and the remaining 3 are already living independently. He lives in his own home. Gimo is a casual farmer of cultivated goods and he has been involved in this type of activity for more than 20 years, along with his son and 1 other helper. He grows green beans, onions and tomatoes among other items which he sells at the markets in Boane and Maputo.
He intends to use this loan to buy farming supplies such as seeds for growing tomatoes, onion, cucumber and to pay the rental of the farming land. The greatest challenge he faces is increasing his productivity, producing more goods to sell, so that he can improve his family's situation and make them more sustainable in the long term.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as tomato seeds, onion seeds, cucumber seeds and to pay for his farming land.

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
A Sra. Laurinda de 59 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 3 filhos todos independente. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da machamba, seus produtos vende a porta da sua casa e nos mercados de Maputo a mais de 25 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera  aplicado para compra  material de construcao (chapas de zinco, cimento, porta e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Laurinda is a 59 year old, single mother to 3 grown-up children. She is a casual business woman who has been selling cultivated goods from the doorway of her home and on the Maputo markets for more than 25 years.
She plans to use this loan to buy building materials, such as zinc sheeting, cement, doors and to pay labour costs, so that she can continue to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as zinc sheeting, cement, doors and to pay labour costs so that she can continue to build her home.

loans.name: Elvis Orlando

texts.es: Elvis de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, el solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Elvis is 36 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife. Elvis has had a corn mill in his home for seven years. He has many customers, particularly women who make tortillas who come to grind corn. Elvis is able to cover some household costs with the profits from his sales. Elvis is applying for this loan in order to buy necessary items, including fanbelts, discs, blades and more, thus allowing him to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fanbelts, discs, blades and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y sus dos hijos, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada y quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando los balcones a las ventanas que muestra en la fotografía, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de balcones y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en: Walter is 37 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his mother and his two children. Walter works for a private company. He wants to make improvements to his house by installing iron railings on his windows (shown in the photo). Walter, however, does not have enough money to do this work and so is applying for a loan in order to buy iron railings and to pay labourers. Walter's family will then be able to live in a more comfortable and safer environment.

loans.use: to buy iron railings and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana de 28 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 28 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her family.Ana has been making a living selling clothes for five years. She works as a street vendor in the local areas and is able to cover some household expenses with her profits. Ana is applying for a loan in order to buy more clothes in bulk for men and women, and thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in bulk for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Dúo Bendicion De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bendición de San Miguel
Este dúo esta formado por Cindy Johana ella tiene 27 años de edad, y se dedica a la agricultura como siembra de ejote, arveja china, suchini, y radicho  mini zanahoria, desde ya hace varios años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de repuestos para el carro que utilizan para transportar sus verduras a la cooperativa de la localidad, su mayor deseo es repararlo lo más pronto posible porque es su medio de transporte principal, ya que solo están esperando la cosecha de su arveja, para exportarlo y vender.
texts.en:
The "Bendición de San Miguel"

One member of this duo is 27-year-old Cindy Johana. She has been working in farming growing peas,string beans, courgettes, mini-carrots and radishes for a number of years. She is applying for this loan in order to buy spare parts for the vehicle she uses for transporting vegetables to the local cooperative. Cindy's biggest wish is to repair her car as soon as possible as this is her main mode of transport and her peas are almost ready to be picked and sold.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a vehicle used for transporting vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Augusto

texts.es: Jose de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino desde hace varios años, adicional a eso también cultiva granos básicos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de unos novillos para poder continuar con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: José is 54 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife. José has been working raising bovine cattle for a number of years, and also grows basic grains. He is applying for this loan in order to buy a few heifers, continue with his business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy some heifers.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo Buena Vista La encargada de este grupo es la señora Marta Lucrecia quien se dedica  al bordado de blusas de tela a máquina, venta de delantales típicos, confecciona cuellos de blusas, fajas bordadas, añadido de cortes típicos desde hace 25 años, la cual es una habilidad heredada de su madre.  Su sueño es llegar a ser  una gran bordadora de calidad y vender sus blusas en muchos lugares y algún día exportarlos.   Al lado de su esposo y sus cuatro hijos sigue luchando cada día para darle a sus hijos las oportunidades de superase cada momento las cuales ella no tuvo.  Las fechas navideñas se aproximan y necesita invertir en telas de blusas para bordad, necesita comprar muchas telas de diferentes colores y así ofrecer variedad y necesita comprar conos por caja, los que tiene no le alcanza y por eso necesita un préstamo para comprar lo que le falta y aprovechar las ventas.
texts.en: Marta Lucrecia, head of Buena Vista Duo, is an embroiderer. She does mainly blouses, aided by her trusty sewing machine, but she also sells traditional aprons, blouse collars, embroidered sashes, and traditional clothing. She has been in this trade, which she learned from her mother, for twenty-five years. Her dream is to become a master embroiderer and sell her blouses in many parts of the country and, maybe one day, even abroad. Together with her husband and their four children, she strives every day to give the little ones every chance to get ahead in life that she did not have. With the Christmas season approaching, she needs to buy more cloth of all colours to embroider blouses, in order to have a greater variety of products on offer. She also needs to buy boxes of sewing thread, since what she has will not be enough. Thus, she asks for a loan in order to buy the supplies she needs and take advantage of the holiday season to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs to make traditional clothing and sell it.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Elizabeth tiene 42 años, es casada y madre de 1 niño estudiante de primaria, Su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por su esposo, hijo, su padre y un hermano. Todos viven con ella y la apoyan en sus desiciones y en el negocio. Ella es comerciante desde hace 9 años, y su negocio es la oportunidad de sentirse útil, productiva, y ocupar su tiempo en algo que le gusta mucho, vender y satisfacer a sus clientes. Doña Elizabeth recientemente afrontó un dolor muy grande que fue la pérdida de su madre, hecho que la golpeó mucho ya que era ella la encargada de velar por su bienestar, sin embargo lucha por sobreponerse y seguir adelante, ayudando a su familia económicamente. 
Inicio su negocio con su hermana en un cuarto en la sala de su casa, el cual acondiciono, y es actualmente su pequeña tienda. Con el paso de los años logró consolidar su patrimonio, actualmente tiene mucha demanda, es por eso que necesita está inyección de capital de trabajo. . 
En un cuarto en la parte delantera de su casa, sin comprometer la privacidad de ella, está su pequeña tienda, vende pantalones jeans, que es su fuerte, ropa para dama, y una línea muy fuerte de artículos para bebé, ya que son productos que tienen mucha salida. Sus clientes llegan a la tienda, pero también ella va a otras comunidades a vender. El crédito es la oportunidad de hacer una importante inversión en mercadería para aprovechar la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and married, and has one son, who attends primary school. Her family is comprised of her husband, her son, her father and one brother. They all live with her and support her decisions and her business. She has had her shop for nine years, and she likes it because it gives her the chance to feel useful, productive, and to occupy her time with an activity she enjoys, namely selling products and making her customers happy. Elizabeth recently had to face a great sorrow, the death of her mother. She felt this loss very keenly because she was the one who took care of her mother. She is doing her best to overcome this sorrow and to keep helping her family financially.
She started her business with her sister in a small room at her house, which she set up so that it now is a little shop. Over the years, she managed to increase her working capital, but she is, at the moment, facing too great a demand, which is why she needs more capital.
The little shop in question is located in a room at the front of the house, so that it does not disturb her privacy. She sells mainly jeans, but also ladies' clothing and quite a lot of baby stuff, which are products very much in demand. Her customers go to her shop but she also goes to other villages to sell her wares there. She sees the loan as a good opportunity to invest in her business by buying a lot of merchandise so as to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es una joven de 21 años de edad, es soltera y está esperando el nacimiento de su hijo, ella creció con sus padres que se dedicaban al comercio de  frutas, en la actualidad vive con su padre y con sus 2 hermanos, ya que su madre falleció, el crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de frutas para venderlas en el mercado y de este negocio espera seguir mejorando para estar preparada con lo necesario en la llegada de su bebe.
texts.en: Patricia, a young lass of 21, is single and awaits the birth of her child. She grew up with her parents, who were fruit traders. At the moment, she lives with her father and her two brothers. Her mother is dead. She will use the loan to buy fruit to sell at the market. She hopes to keep increasing the income derived from her business so as to be ready with everything she needs for when the baby comes.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Maria Jeaneth

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos y gallinas en el mercado municipal desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos y gallinas por mayor y si tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 40 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She has worked selling chickens and hens in the city market for several years. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices. She is asking for a loan to buy more chickens and hens wholesale so she can have more profit.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and hens wholesale.

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirna, con el financiamiento anterior mantiene su negocio en el mercado, pues surtió el inventario con lociones, cremas, corporales y otros artículos de primera necesidad. Las ventas son mejores y ha generado nuevos ingresos, su familia se encuentra en óptimas condiciones.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo por los buenos resultados que estos le dan y para mantener la continuidad de su buen desarrollo, comprara talcos, cosméticos, papel higiénico, gel para el cabello, etc., le permitirá cubrir las nuevas demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Mirna maintains her business in the market. She stocked up on lotions, creams, body creams and other staple products. The sales have generated new income and her family is in optimal condition.  

She is opting for another loan because of the good results that they give and to maintain her good development. She will buy powders, cosmetics, toilet paper, hair gel, etc. This will allow her to cover her customer's demands.

loans.use: to buy powders, cosmetics, toiler paper, hair gel, etc. This will allow her to cover her customers new demands.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, su esposo esta en estados unidos y le ayuda económicamente, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. ya que le ha ido muy bien en estos últimos meses y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her two children. Her husband is in the United States and he helps her financially. She has a small store located in her residence. She has a lot of customers because of the good prices. She is asking for a loan again to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet breads, etc. It has gone very well for her in theses last few months, and this way she can have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs. basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has five children who are in school.

Editha has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell in her business.

Editha has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity.

Kache operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Emarita

texts.pt:
Emarita is 62 years old and has six children. Emarita is married and has one child in school.

Emarita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Emarita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emarita has been for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
texts.en:
Emarita is 62 years old and has six children. Emarita is married and has one child in school.

Emarita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Emarita requested a 10,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emarita has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
Elda es una mujer de 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 12 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ una área rural que agrupa a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de acomodar esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Elda es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Sus hijos estudian en la escuela pública y viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña, como ‘Pacumuto’; Existen más de 10 tipos del tradicional pacumuto,  como ser de carne de res, cerdo, pollo, ubre, tripa, jiba, etc. El más conocido es  de carne de res. Pacumuto son trozos de carne de res que se ensartan en brochetas con otros ingredientes, como pimientos rojo y verdes, cebolla,  generalmente se sirve con arroz cocido con queso, yuca , Ají. “esta comida es muy tradicional en esta región y generalmente la receta se pasa de generación en generación…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante y servir solo pacumuto en todas sus variedades. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una cocina, mesas, sillas e insumos de cocina como; arroz, aceite, diferentes tipos de carne, etc. Para ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 7 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta  actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elda solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cocina, mesas, sillas e insumos de cocina para cocinar comida tradicional.
texts.en:
Elda is a 50-year-old woman who lives with her life partner and has three children aged 10, 12, and 15. She sells traditional cruceña food [i.e. from Santa Cruz]. She is a good mother and an independent, entrepreneurial, generous, understanding and hardworking person. She works in “El Torno”, a rural municipality where people work producing meat, milk, vegetables, grains, etc. There are also wholesalers, who are in charge of distributing these products to the different city markets. The region has warm and humid tropical weather, with a yearly average temperature between 21 and 35 ºC [70-95 ºF].

Elda is dark-skinned, has long black hair and is short. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, but she speaks Spanish due to cultural reasons and because of her job. Her children go to a public school. They all live in a house of their own, built with bricks and served with water and electricity. She sells traditional cruceña food, such as “pacumuto”. There are more than ten types of pacumuto, e.g. beef, pork, chicken, udder, entrails, hump, etc. The most popular one is made with beef. Pacamuto is prepared with skewered pieces of meat and other ingredients, such as green and red peppers and onion. It is usually served with boiled rice with cheese, cassava and chili. “This food is traditional of this region. The recipe is passed down from generation to generation,” she says.

Her dream is to have a restaurant specialized in all kinds of pacumuto. She wants to invest in her business and buy a grill, tables, chairs and ingredients such as rice, vegetable oil, different types of meat, etc. in order to expand her business. This is her seventh loan with the institution. She has been in this business for twenty years.

This is why Elda is requesting a loan to buy a grill, tables, chairs and ingredients to prepare traditional food.

loans.use: to buy a grill, tables, chairs, and ingredients to prepare traditional food.

loans.name: Teeltaaba De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur OUSSENI est le  représentant  du groupe TEELTAABA1 DE ROLLO. Marié, il est père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé à 12 ans et le moins âgé a 02 semaines. 01 va à l’école. Il  a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraichage depuis 05 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il  veut  s’acheter  04 sacs d’engrais ; 02 bidons d’essence.
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ousseni is the representative of the group TEELTAABA1 DE ROLLO. He is married and is the father of five children. The oldest is 12 years and the youngest is two weeks.  One child is in school. He has four dependants.

Ousseni has been a market gardener for five years.  He buys goods in the market in his neighborhood.  He wants to buy four bags of fertiliser and two canisters of petrol. Ousseni wishes to save his income.  He aspires to increase his business and meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertiliser and two canisters of petrol.

loans.name: Tsimbou

texts.fr: TSIMBOU est commerçante de pagnes depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne une fois par mois par manque de moyen au grand marché de Lomé ;au fait elle est un femme âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants qui vit à Adidogomé, et pour vendre elle se promène de quartier en quartier. TSIMBOU sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock afin de mieux vendre et faire assez de bénéfices pour s’occuper de ses enfants, et mieux épargner.
texts.en:
Tsimbou has been a pagne [traditional West African fabric] seller since 2003. Due to lack of funds she stocks up once a month at the Grand Market of Lomé. She is, by the way, a woman of 44 who lives in Adidogomé and is married with three children. In order to sell, she walks from neighborhood to neighborhood.

Tsimbou is requesting a loan so that she can increase her stock in order to improve sales and make enough income to care for her children and save more.

loans.use: to buy 34 pieces of pagne.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon (in photo) is a 57-year-old widow who lives in the Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia.

Chhon has been married since 1980, has one son and two daughters. One is married and two are company staff.

She has been a weaver and farmer for 20 years of experience, while her daughter is a garment worker with two years of experience. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to take to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto desde hace varios años y los comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado de repasto y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 21 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has been raising grazing cattle for several years and she sells them in the nearby towns. She lives in her own home with her family group and she is asking for a loan to buy grazing cattle so she can have better income.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Kansenene United Traders Group

texts.en: Erika, a member of Kansenene United Traders, is a retailer and at the same does farming (growing sweet potatoes to supplement his income). He faces challenges of customers who don't pay him on time. However, he has a vision of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Erika needs a loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil and salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil and salt for selling.

loans.name: Khady Dia

texts.fr: KHADY est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite à quelques kilomètres du Guichet et est une habituée de ce dernier. Elle évolue dans l’aviculture et à une expérience de plus de 2 ans dans cette activité. Elle n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Elle a comme charges particulières les soins médicaux car c’est son mari qui prend en charges toutes les charges quotidiennes de sa famille. KHADY commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer  à 18h. Elle demande ce crédit pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment pour volaille. Elle voudrait à l’avenir avoir un champ de banane pour augmenter ses revenus et terminer sa maison qui est en construction.  Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Khady is a married woman and a mother. She lives several kilometers from the branch and is a regular there. She has been building up an aviculture activity and has more than two years' experience in this field. She does not have any relatives who are borrowing from the institution. She has specific responsibility for medical expenses but her husband covers all the famiy's daily outgoings. Khady begins her day at 10 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 6 o'clock in the evening. She is requesting this loan to buy chicks and poultry food. In the future she would like to have a banana field so she can increase her income and finish her house which is being build. She would thereby be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry food to practise aviculture.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: IBRAHIMA  est un homme marié et père de famille qui habite dans un quartier  qui est en face du Guichet. Il est un habitué du guichet et est à son 13ème prêt. Il évolue dans la confection de Draps en achetant des tissu et accessoires. Il n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire et demande ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. IBRAHIMA gère toutes les charges financières de la famille. Il a une expérience de plus de 15 ans et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir, il voudrait améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille en augmentant ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coté. Il souhaite aussi avoir 03 ateliers et d’autres machines pour  satisfaire ses clients potentiels.
texts.en: Ibrahima is a married man and father who lives in the neighborhood opposite the branch. He is a regular at the branch and is on his 13th loan. He has built up a business making sheets by buying fabric and accessories. He does not have any relatives who are borrowing from the insitution and is requesting this loan to boost his stock and diversify his product base. Ibrahima manages all his family's expenses. He has more than 15 years experience and begins his day at 9 o'clock, finishing at 8 o'clock in the evening. In the future he would like to be able to improve his family's nutritional conditions by increasing his income and putting money aside. He would also like to have three workshops and other machines so that he can satisfy potential customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and accessories for making sheets and selling them.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, tiene una mejor situación económica con la que respalda el pago de sus deudas y ofrece a sus hijos mejor alimentación y educación, ella invirtió el préstamo anterior en animales concentrado para alimentarlos fortaleció el negocio.
Como ya es el tiempo justo para finalizar los trabajos agrícolas ha decidido solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar cerdos, alimento para pollos y pagar los costos de la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos, de esta manera seguirá trabajando, los clientes estarán satisfechos y colaborara con su compañero de vida en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
María has a better financial situation to back up the payment of her debts and offer her children better food and education. She invested the previous loan in animals and concentrate to feed them and fortify the business.  

Since it is time to finalize the farm work, she has decided to ask for a new loan to buy pigs and chicken feed and to pay to bring in the harvest of basic grains. This way she can keep working and the customers will be satisfied, and she can help her companion with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chicken feed, as well as to pay for bringing in the harvest of basic grains so that she can keep on working.

loans.name: Rosa Elsa

texts.es:
Rosa, desea continuar trabajando con créditos, por lo que está solicitando más capital para comprar concentrado para las aves de corral y cerdos, también pagará mozos para que le ayuden a recolectar la cosecha de granos básicos de la temporada.
Para Rosa son muy importantes los créditos para mejorar el negocio, con la inversión anterior ha logrado estabilizar la situación financiera familiar y bajar el nivel de endeudamiento.
texts.en:
Rosa wants to continue working with the loans. That is why she is asking for more capital to buy concentrate for the poultry and pigs. She will also pay laborers to harvest the basic grains for the season. 

For Rosa the loans are very important to improve the business. With the previous loan she has been able to stabilize the family financial situation and lower her level of debt.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for her poultry and pigs as well as to pay the laborers so they can help her harvest the basic grains for the season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plates and spoons for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 34 years old. She is married with three children aged between one and five years.  She sells sugar cane and has been in a business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar cane to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane to resell.

loans.name: Yankadi Group

texts.fr: YANKADI est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 10 femmes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier et se sont connues par rapport de voisinage. Elles se réunissent tous les 15 jours pour organiser des tontines. Leur présidente s’appelle Coumba, elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle est reconnue sur la photo par la main levée. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes et a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité. Elle possède une étale au marché et demande ce crédit pour renforcer et diversifier son stock de marchandises. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais médicaux de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir elle voudrait faire des voyages au niveau des pays comme le Maroc et le Nigéria pour acheter des marchandises et venir les vendre dans son pays.
texts.en: Yankadi is a group made up of ten women. They all live in the same district and got to know each other as neighbors. They get together every 15 days to organise "tontines" (a revolving finance system where each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to different members). Their president is called Coumba and she is married and a mother; she is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She has built up a business selling fruit and vegetables and has over 20 years in this domain. She has a stall in the market and is requesting this loan to boost and diversify her stock. She helps out her husband with the daily outgoings and her children's medical expenses. She begins her day at 9 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 7 o'clock in the evening. In the future she would like to travel to countries such as Morocco and Nigeria to buy her goods and bring them back to sell in her country.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 41 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, rice, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, rice, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nancy has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nancy has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a married woman and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity.

Nyadzua has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en:
Tasiu is a maize farmer from Sabuwar Abuja village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tasiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tasiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Tasiu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 22 years old now.

Irene has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Irene has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. 

Nyevu operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. 

She has been running a business of cloth trade for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her community. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth. 

Halima requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and high-quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Hafezan

texts.en:
Hafezan is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children and is very motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing, health and education.  

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house for the last six years. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow their business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, sugar, rice, oil and beverages, etc. to meet the increasing demand in their store. 

Hafezan is expecting boost in their earnings and dreams of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, sugar, rice, oil and beverages, etc. to meet the increasing demand in their store.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Adamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Shaem, Vincent and Joy.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Adamu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 32-year-old married father of one child who has been working in selling fruits and vegetables since 2012, to support his family in a well managed way. Haytham's business is mobile; he visits nearby villages to sell his goods and develop his family's living.

Haytham is well known among his customers with his special products and prices set. Although his business is going on just fine, Haytham needs extra income to cover increasing living needs. Currently, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to continue construction work at his house before the coming winter season, to keep his family living in a healthy medium.

He hopes that in the future he can save enough money to buy his own shop and settle down.

loans.use: To continue construction work at his house before the coming winter season, to keep his family living in a healthy medium.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian is 26 years old. He is married to Wilkister and together they have been blessed with two children of 5 and 1 year. 

Fabian runs a butchery, a business he has done for the last 13 years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Fabian has requested his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000, which he will use to purchase more stock of meat as we approach this festive season.

With the anticipated profits, Fabian will be able to expand his business even further. His hope and dream for the future is to prosper in order to help others succeed as well.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of meat.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. 

She has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for the last three years. They have two buffaloes. Fatima looks after the buffaloes and collects the milk from them while her husband sells their milk in nearby areas. They both are supporting their family.
