However, in order to provide good education to their children, they need to earn more income. Therefore, Fatima has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. They hope that increased milk production will help them in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kouser has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. She also deals in sale of animals on a seasonal basis. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her eighth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Lorenza Marisol

texts.es: Lorenza de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, maicillo, pipian, entre otros, su esposo le ayuda en las siembras y con las ventas que realiza de sus productos logran salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Lorenza, 37 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. She works in agriculture, growing corn, sorghum, and pipian squash, among others. Her husband helps her with the planting and with the sales that they make of their products. They manage to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve the land shown in the photo to be able to continue with her work and have more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Erika Yessenia

texts.es:
Erika, invirtió el préstamo anterior en mercadería para la tienda y para la venta de atoles, de esta manera ella se ha mantenido trabajando, comenta que sus clientes son mucho más, tiene mejores ganancias y las condiciones familiares son más dignas.
Requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar productos enlatados, pan, granos básicos, algunas verduras, bebidas y otros productos propios de la temporada navideña, su objetivo es cubrir las nuevas demandas de sus clientes y ofrecer productos nuevos.
texts.en:
Erika invested the last loan in merchandise for the store and for the sale of atole [hot corn-based drink], in this way she has continued working. She says that she has many more customers, she has better income, and her family conditions are more decent. 

She needs a new loan to purchase canned goods, bread, basic grains, some vegetables, drinks, and other products for the Christmas season. Her goal is to meet her customers' new demands and offer new products.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bread, basic grains, some vegetables, drinks, and other products for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee desde hace varios años un comedor ubicado en su casa, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area, has had a restaurant in her house for several years. She has many customers because of her good prices. She lives in her own house with her family. She is asking for a loan to purchase rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. to vary her menu and in that way have more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Norma Maribel

texts.es: Norma de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, Ella se dedica a elaborar pupusas y pizza, posee mucha clientela, Norma solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más ya que le ha ido muy bien en los últimos meses y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Norma, 31 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She works making pupusas and pizza and has many customers. Norma asks for another loan to purchase flour, yeast, butter, cans, and everything necessary to be able to produce more since it has been going very well in recent months, and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, butter, cans, and everything necessary.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the cost of harvesting his crop of basic grains and transport them to his house.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio es un hombre de 43 años de edad, viudo, tiene 5 hijos de 22, 16, 15, 12 y 7 años, y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es buena padre, emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Utavicullaguani’; caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de cereales y vegetales del lugar, como la quinua; el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Lucio es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que se encargan de la agricultura y estudian en la escuela, su hijo mayor es independiente, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la pesca en bote con red; La pesca del lago Titicaca es uno de los artes de pesca más bonitos, artesanos, y respetuosos con el lago y los fondos marinos que existen, ya que este arte de pesca consiste en arrojar al lago una línea de red, que suele ser desde 30 metros de largo. Al dejar caer la red en el fondo, y dejarla allí un día a modo de trampa, y luego simplemente recogerla, hace que no arrastre y destruya los fondos marinos, y solo queden atrapadas piezas del tamaño que se busca según grosor de red, y pescar solo las variedades que se quieren, “El wallaqe (comida tradicional) tiene un pez ingrediente importante que le da el sabor y se denomina karachi…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una pescadería. El desea realizar la compra de un bote de pesca porque el que tiene esta viejo y no brinda las condiciones de seguridad necesarias, también comprará redes de pesca porque las que tiene se encuentran dañadas y necesita renovarlas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 28 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lucio solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote de pesca y redes para pescar.
texts.en:
Lucio is a 43 year old widower who has five children aged 22, 16, 15, 12 and 7 years old. He works as a fisherman. He is s good father, enterprising, independent, consistent, responsible and hard-working.

His business takes place in ‘Utavicullaguani’ by the sacred Lake Titicaca, an agricultural area where they also raise cattle sheep and members of the llama family. He lives from fishing and also from grains and vegetables of the area like quinoa and chuno (dried potatoes), beams, potatoes. etc. It is characterized by a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 1 to 12 degrees Celsius and where the sun's ray strike the earth's surface with force.

Lucio is short, dark-skinned with short black hair. He speaks Aymara and speaks Spanish for business. He shares his life with his children who take care of the agriculture and go to school. His oldest son is independent. He lives in a house made out of adobe with a reed roof that has electricity and a well.

His business is fishing with a boat and a net. The fishing on Lake Titicaca is one of the most beautiful fishing arts, small scale and respectful of the lake and the maritime treasures it has. This art consists of throwing in a line of net that is about 30 meters long. The net settles to the bottom where it is left for a day to act as a trap. Then it is collected, making sure it is not dragged ruining the lake floor, only trapping the pieces that are the size of the netting and fishing only the species desired. The "wallage" (local food) has an important fish ingredient that gives it flavor and is called "karachi", he comments.

His dream is to have a fish store. He wants to buy a fishing boat as the one he has is old and is no longer safe. He will also buy fishing nets as his are damaged and need repairing. This is his first loan with the institution in the 28 years he has been in this business. For these reasons Lucio is requesting a loan to buy a fishing boat and nets.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Dúo Jesucristo Group

texts.es: Dúo Jesucristo La señora Silveria de 61 años de edad, es la encargada de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de suéteres mexicanos, taiwaneses, nacionales, blusas de tela, servilletas típicas, playeras, camisas para caballeros desde hace 40 años.  Al lado de su esposo están muy contentos por la venta que tienen ya que los dos son comerciantes y cada mañana se levantan con el deseo de atender su negocio.  Sus hijos ya son adultos y los apoyan en todo.  Ya tiene varios pedidos de suéteres y chumpas, pero no le son suficientes los que tienen en el negocio, por eso necesitan comprar por docena y diferentes precios, calidad, tamaños para no quedarles mal a sus compradores quienes confían en ella ya que también venden por docena.
texts.en: Jesucristo Pair - Silveria, 61 years old, is in charge of this group. She has worked selling Mexican, Taiwanese, and national sweaters, fabric blouses, traditional scarves, t-shirts, and men's shirts for the past 40 years. At her husband's side, they are very happy for the sales that they have, since they both are salespeople and every morning they get up with the desire to tend their business. Their children are now adults and support them in everything.  They already have some orders for sweaters and jackets, but the ones they have in the business are not sufficient, so they need to buy by the dozen and at different prices, qualities and sizes, to not look bad to their customers who trust them since they also sell by the dozen.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a flat top range, four tables, eight benches and merchandise for her small store.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analiza is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analiza has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of clothes to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for four years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of clothes to sell

loans.name: Kufuna

texts.en:
Kufuna is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Kufuna owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kufuna has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 35 years old and all of her children are in school.

Jocelyn has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a single woman who has no children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food  

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbors- especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting (20,000 KES), she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelia is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, esta separado vive solo en casa de los sobrinos en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz,  de profesión es confeccionista de sombreros. Jorge quiere un credito para comprar tela y otros materiales que le permitan confeccionar sombreros
 
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas en su propio domicilio; tiene una sola maquina con la cual trabaja, los dias sabados va directo a una de las ferias populares de La Paz, lugar donde hace la entrega de sus pedidos, con esta actividad el se mantiene y cubre sus mínimas necesidades ya que vive solo y no cuenta con ninguna ayuda a pesar de vivir en casa de sus sobrinos. Jorge goza de buena salud y como ha demostrado anteriormente es digno de confianza
texts.en:
Jorge is separated and lives in a house his nephews own in Tembladerani, a neighborhood of La Paz. He makes hats and is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and other materials needed to make hats.

He currently works more than eight hours, at home. He has just one machine and goes on Saturdays to one of the public markets of La Paz, where he delivers his orders. This is how he sustains himself and covers his basic needs. He lives alone and does not have any additional support despite living with his nephews. Jorge is a healthy and (as he has demonstrated before) trustworthy man.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other materials to make hats.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlita is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marlita has a buying and selling scrap business in the Philippines. Marlita requested a PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional scrap to sell.

Marlita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Marlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional scrap to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a cosmetic shop business; her customers are town dwellers and neighbors- especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwatime has operated a food selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chairs, tables, and plates for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, and plates for her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman she has three children, all of whom attend school. Catherine owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Catherine has operated a motor vehicle business in her neighborhood serving the neighbors and passersby. 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase another motor vehicle for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase another motor vehicle for her business

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos pero solo uno estudia, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero aprendió a leer gracias a un programa de alfabetización que llegó a su comunidad., su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

José desde pequeño es agricultor de granos básicos, aprendió de sus padres y abuelos, hoy en día es comerciante, vende sorbetes naturales en la capital, por lo que se queda allá y cada 15 días viaja de regreso a su comunidad para estar con su familia y después regresa a seguir trabajando duro para su familia. 

Solicita el préstamo  para   comprar un freezer que  tendrá en su vivienda para vender sorbetes a la comunidad   además utilizará $400.00 en la compra de tejas para mejorar el techo de su vivienda que está dañado. José espera   aumentar sus ventas en el negocio de la venta de sorbetes naturales y también mejorar su vivienda que es de bahareque,  es insegura para su familia y quiere darle una mejor comodidad a sus hijos y a su esposa.
texts.en:
José, 43 years old, is partnered and has two children but only one goes to school. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school, but he learned to read thanks to a literacy program that came to his community. His partner is a housewife and only she and his children live with him.

Since he was young, José has been a farmer of basic grains. He learned from his parents and grandparents and these days is a salesperson. He sells natural sorbets in the capital, for which he stays there and every two weeks he returns to his community to be with his family, and later to return to continue working hard for his family. 

He asks for a loan to purchase a freezer that he will have in his home to sell sorbets in his community, in addition he will use $400.00 to purchase tiles to repair the roof on his house which is damaged. José hopes to increase his sales in his business selling natural sorbets and also improve his house which is made from bamboo. It is unsafe for his family and he wants to provide more comfort for his family and his partner.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and tiles to improve the roof on his house.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María, se dedica a vender ropa para ambos sexos de manera ambulante, es una persona que lucha diariamente para lograr tener ingresos con los que cumple con sus obligaciones dentro de su hogar; está soltera y vive únicamente con su hijo de 8 años, quien depende económicamente de ella, su negocio lo inicio por motivación propia y por necesidad de dar a su hijo una mejor vida, desempeña esta actividad de ocho de la mañana a tres de la tarde y lo hace desde hace 7 años, en la administración no representa dificultades por su experiencia, el riesgo es la delincuencia que está enfrentado el país.
Invertirá en ropa para ambos sexos, tales como pantalones, vestidos, camisas, faldas, etc., ofrecerá nuevos estilos de ropa para que sus clientes estén más satisfechos, desea aprovechar la época navideña para tener ingresos extras. La competencia es muy alta pero ella cuenta con una cartera de clientes establecida.
Sus sueños son trabajar mucho para mejorar las circunstancias familiares, enseñar a su hijo a trabajar para que pueda defenderse en un futuro y darle una mejor educación.
texts.en:
María works as a street vendor selling clothing for both sexes. She is a person who struggles daily to be able to have income with which to meet her household obligations. She is single and only lives with her 8-year-old son, who depends on her economically. She began her business from her own motivation and for the need to give her son a better life. She does this work from eight in the morning to three in the afternoon and she has done it for the past seven years. There is no problem with running the business due to her experience. The risk is the delinquency that is confronting the country.

She will invest in clothing for both sexes, such as pants, dresses, shirts, skirts, etc. and she will offer new clothing styles so that her customers are more satisfied. She wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to have extra income. The competition is very high but she has an established customer base.

Her dream is to work a lot to improve her family's circumstances, teach her son to work so that he can take care of himself in the future and give him a better education.

loans.use: to invest in clothing for both sexes such as pants, dresses, shirts, skirts, etc., she will offer new clothing styles.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is a 53-year-old married woman with two children. She is IDP (internally displaced person) who lives in the Bilasuvar region with her family. Her daughter is married but her son is single. 

Gulnar is a farmer. She grows fruits and vegetables on her land. Her son and her husband help her in this business. She is a hardworking woman and she has 12 years experience in this business.

Her monthly income from this business is 100 AZN but it is not enough to cover family needs. For this reason she needs a loan to buy new fruit trees, seeds and fertilizers. Gulnar hopes that Kiva lenders will help her to expand her business. This is going to be her first loan. Please support Gulnar.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maclaren Group

texts.en:
Magdalena, who is in her early 50s, is married with five children- two are still in school and three of them are grown-ups. She has been selling charcoal for 18 years now. She works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Magdalena's 17th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, added more  rooms on her house (although they are renting), and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of taking her kids to good colleges and to buy a car.

Magdalena will share this loan with her loan group "Maclaren" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en:
Fazilat is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. They have two buffaloes. Fazilat looks after them and collects the milk from them while her husband sells their milk in nearby areas. They both are supporting their family. 

However, in order to meet their household expenditures, they need to earn more income. Therefore, Fazilat has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She expects a boost in her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Pepiniere Group

texts.en:
Pepiniere is a group from Wezesha Project, situated in Eastern of Democratic Republic of Congo. This is their 5th loan and they are committed to continue to pay on time so that lenders continue to have confidence in them.
Chalumenge, one of the member of Pepiniere, is 50 years old and lives in the city of Bukavu. She is married  and has six children. Chalumenge is motivated to provide her children with good food and education. Her husband is unemployed so she is the only income earner for the family. To help expand her business Chalumenge has requested a loan of $250 to buy more petrol for sale in order to generate profit and increase her the size of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more petrol for retail

loans.name: Atukuzwe Group

texts.en: Bisozi is a member of Atukuzwe Group who are part of Wezesha Project in Bukavu, Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. She is a widow and the mother of 6 children and she also supports two other people. Charcoal has been her business for the last 3 years and it is the main source of fuel for cooking in the region. Bisozi will receive a loan of $400USD to increase the stock of her charcoal allowing her to make more profit. Through her profits she plans to pay her rent, for nutritious food for her family and pay the children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase 27 large sacs of charcoal.

loans.name: Neema Ya Golgotha Group

texts.en:
Neema ya Golgotha is a group of businesswomen part of Wezesha project in the city of Bukavu. This loan will be their 6th in the project and they have an excellent record of repayment.

Mwanyuke is a 33 year-old married mother of 5. She will be using the loan for her business, and the loan of $400 will allow her to purchase more soap for sale at better prices. She is hopeful that she will be profitable. With her profit she aims to support her children's education, medical bills, and help her to install more secure doors on her house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts for the motor on his mill which is vital tp keep in good condition.

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en: Duterimbere is a group led by Jeanne d'Arc who is 24 years old. The group name means “vision” in English. She has been a group leader for three years. She sells foodstuffs and has been selling in her business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, beans and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beans and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Naresh Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Sunitaben (at center in the picture), the group leader, runs a clothing microenterprise. She sells saris, dresses, shirts, T-shirts and stoles for a small profit after buying them at wholesale rates. Through her clothing business, she earns Rs. 2,500 per month, which is 25% of her household income, and supports her household with her husband. The income generated through the business keeps them financially afloat, and helps them envisage a plan for a secure future. 

However, Sunitaben's monthly household savings of Rs. 5,000 won't suffice for her future plans as well as her business expansion objectives. Her idea of expanding her microenterprise is to: buy the complete inventory of her clothing business in bulk, cater to the increased demand from her customers, and increase her profits. As an added benefit, buying in bulk will help her negotiate better purchase rates from her suppliers, improving her profit margins. Overall, she stands to net an extra Rs. 4,000 each month, should she put her plan into action. Of this, she will take home Rs. 1,500, and will reinvest the rest in developing her small business further. 

Raising the capital for her expansion plan is not possible through banks, since she is a low-income entrepreneur who needs a microloan below the amounts banks typically offer as high-interest business loans. So, along with the four members from her group, all seeking to expand their respective micro-enterprises, Sunitaben has decided to raise the capital through crowdfunding. Kailashben, Lilaben, Dhaniben, and Lilaben want to invest in growing their respective milk parlor, ready-made garments, wood, and cutlery microenterprises. Together, they are seeking a loan of Rs. 70,000.

As she ages, Sunitaben wants to ensure financial stability for herself and her husband. She needs to make her small clothing business a sustainable income source that will help them live comfortably, and cover any medical bills in their old age. Your loan will help Sunitaben grow her clothing business. You will help her and four other families enjoy the benefits of an increase in profits, savings, and self-sufficiency. It will ensure the financial and social stability of five households.

loans.use: to boost her inventory of saris, dresses, shirts, T-shirts, and stoles and grow her clothing microenterprise

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school. Rose owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rose operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her area.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.en: Salama group is from Wezesha project in the Bukavu, Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. This group contains five members. Not too long ago one of the members Felista, said that she was at the lowest point when she didn't have enough money to keep her business going. When she joined Wezesha Project she was grateful to obtain credit that allowed her to grow her business into what she knew it could be. Felista is 55 years old and is a widow. She is asking for the loan of $250 the loan will be use to buy 20 sacs of charcoal and the transport to get them to town. With her profits she will buy a pig which she can breed and use to make more money, a true entrepreneur.

loans.use: To restock 20 sacs of charcoal and to pay the transport to the city.

loans.name: Tuungane 2 Group

texts.en: Tuungane 2 is a group of 5 members from the city of Bukavu, Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. Chakupewa is a member of Tuugane 2 and 47 years. She has four children and is living with her family since her husband disappeared 8 years ago. Chakupewa is always focusing on the well being of her children. The loan she is requesting, like the rest of her group is $250 and she will use this money to purchase more second hand shoes and expand the stock of her business. She plans to use the profits to take care of her children by providing the essentials like healthy food and education.

loans.use: To buy more second hand shoes

loans.name: Anna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Anna, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar quesillo, maíz, bebidas, condimentos, aceite, etc., así tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta de meriendas típicas, tortillas y pupusas, pues sus nuevas demandas son mayores y provoca que su inventario no sea suficiente para cubrirlas.
El apoyo que recibió con el préstamo anterior ha sido de mucha importancia, para brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes y las ganancias son de utilidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones, comenta que sigue apoyando a su hija para que reciba buena educación.
texts.en: Anna needs a new loan to buy cheese, corn, drinks, condiments, oil, etc. so she will have raw material to make her traditional meals, tortillas and pupusas. Her demand is now greater so that her inventory does not cover it. The support she received with the last loan was very important, it allowed her to provide better service to her clients and the profits were useful in meeting her obligations. She adds that she is continuing to support her daughter so that she gets a good education.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn, drinks, condiments, oil etc to have raw material to make her traditional meals, tortillas and pupusas to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamjaka

texts.en:
Mwanamjaka is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Mwanamjaka owns a house that  has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamjaka operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Alba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES DEL ALBA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de calzados, venta de comida, venta de basureros, venta de salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felicidad es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio artesanía en latas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa de su difunto esposo, quien le enseño la técnica, con el pasar del tiempo ella continuo con el mismo negocio ya que contaba con un amplio grupo de clientes. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de latas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras recicladoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y las reuniones que ofrece la institución y las reuniones con su Banca Comunal.
texts.en:
Mujeres del Alba Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Felicidad is the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including clothing sales, footwear sales, food sales, trash can sales, and salchipapa [sausage and potatoes] sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Felicidad.  She said she has been in Pro Mujer for seven years, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently she has a business making crafts with cans.  She said she started the business several years ago on the initiative of her deceased husband, who taught her the technique.  She continued with the same business as time went on because she had a lot of customers.

The loan Felicidad is getting is to increase her capital with a bulk purchase of cans from the wholesale recycling vendors in the city of La Paz.  After production, she'll sell them in her sales stall.  This job allows her to earn an income to support her family, because she's a widow and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the savings and the meetings the institution offers, and the meetings with her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy cans wholesale

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
A mother of two children living in Kampong Cham province, Savin is 37 years old. To support her family, she grows rice on one hectare area as her main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

This is Savin's fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She will spend her loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue the Bachelor's degree, majoring in Finance and Banking. Savin hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue the Bachelor's degree, majoring in Finance and Banking.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and shirts, etc. and a variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José, tiene una venta de leña seca y también es motorista de una moto taxi, está acompañado, aún no tiene hijos, cuando formo su hogar inicio su negocio de venta de leña, pero en vista de que sus ingresos no eran los necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar,  busco empleo como motorista de moto taxi, hasta la fecha no tiene dificultades para realizar sus actividades.
Está solicitando un préstamo para comprar leña al por mayoreo y cubrir otros gastos personales, aprovechara la llegada de fin de año para tener mejores ingresos pues las ventas aumentan, espera cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando duro para tener un patrimonio con el que pueda brindar un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en: José sells wood and also is the driver of a motorcycle taxi. He is in a relationship but doesn't have any children yet. When he formed his family he started his business selling wood but as his income was not sufficient to cover the household's needs he found work as a motorcycle taxi driver. Up to now he has had no problems carrying out his businesses. He is requesting a loan to buy wood wholesale and pay for some other personal purchases. He wants to take advantage of the coming end of the year to have greater income as sales increase. He hopes to fulfill the needs of his customers. His dream is to continue to work hard to leave an inheritance so that he can provide a good future for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale and pay for personal expenses, taking advantage of the end of the year sales to have more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oils, creams, (vegetable and chemical), and gel, among other products needed to continue giving good service.

loans.name: Zahraa 1 Group

texts.en:
Zahra is the featured borrower for Zahraa 1 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Zahra is a 24-year-old single lady who has worked in a factory since six months ago to help in covering the needs and expenses of her family. However, she is suffering from a limited salary; thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy carpets to protect her family from the cold winter weather, and she wants to pay for her necessary dental treatment.

Zahra is the lady standing in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Fatima is the first lady on the right, and Zahraa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy carpets to protect her family from the cold winter weather and pay for her necessary dental treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sorghum for making more local drinks for sale.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es:
Samuel, requiere un nuevo crédito pues ve en ellos oportunidades de incrementar sus ventas e ingresos, lo invertirá en una vaca parida y alimento para ganado, fortalecerá su negocio y cuidara mejor los animales en la época de verano.
La ayuda que le da la institución y los inversionistas kiva, le han servido para tener los cerdos y el ganado bien alimentados y sanos permitiéndole que su situación financiera cambie positivamente.
texts.en: Samuel needs a new loan as he has the opportunity to increase his sales and income. He will invest it in a pregnant cow and cattle feed, strengthening his business and providing better care for his animals in the summer. The support given by the institution and the Kiva lenders has allowed him to keep his pigs and cattle well-fed and healthy. This has changed his financial situation in a positive way.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow and cattle feed strengthening his business and providing better care for his animals in the summer.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Amadu would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amadu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Amadu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Garba Dantine

texts.en:
Garba Dantine is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba Dantine would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba Dantine can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Garba Dantine is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sreyleap

texts.en:
Sreyleap is an 18-year-old freshman who is studying banking and finance as her major at a university. She is from Pursat province in Cambodia. Her parents are farmers, and they make their main income by cultivating rice and fattening chickens. 

Since she lacks finances to pay her university fees for four years, Sreyleap has decided to secure a loan. With this loan, she will be able to earn a Bachelor’s degree successfully and have a chance to help improve her family’s living. After graduation, she wants to find a job and then save money to run a business. She also wants to pursue a Master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 28 years old. She is married with three children aged between 2 and 6 years; two of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in a business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more salt and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 10 años, Cecilia está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra  de concentrado y mas pollos para seguir con la crianza ya que le ha ido muy bien en los últimos meses y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Cecilia is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has been raising chickens for the last 10 years. Cecilia is requesting a new loan to buy concentrated feed and more chickens to continue raising chickens. Things have been going well in the past few months and she could have higher income.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and more chickens.

loans.name: Luis  Francisco

texts.es: Luis de 35 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la siembra de hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Luis vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abonos, herbicidas y pesticidas para seguir con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis, 35, lives in his own home with his wife and his three children.  He has earned a living for several years growing vegetables.  He sells his products in the vicinity of his area.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy soil amendments, herbicide, and pesticide to continue growing his crops so he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, herbicide, and pesticide

loans.name: Luz Mila Esperanza

texts.es:
Luz, se mantiene en el mercado con un negocio competitivo y brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes, estos resultados positivos son por la buena inversión del crédito anterior.
Opta por más capital para fortalecer la venta de pupusas, tortillas y la tienda, comprara granos básicos, bebidas, aceite, golosinas y otros materiales, con lo que continuara cubriendo las demandas de sus clientes y teniendo recursos económicos para brindar cada día un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Luz continues in the market with a competitive business and providing good service to her clients. These are positive results from her last loan. She is requesting more capital to strengthen her sales of tortillas, pupusas and her store buying basic grains, drinks, oil, sweets and other materials. She wants to continue to fill the demand from her clients and have the economic resources to provide each day a better style of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, oil, sweets and other materials so she can continue to fill the demand from her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dried fish and shellfish

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bulus, Jibo and Idris. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Haruna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abduru

texts.en: Abduru is 49 years old. He is married with 10 children aged between 3 and 26 years; all of them go to school. He sells clothes and has been selling in a business for 22 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Tijani

texts.en:
Tijani is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Tijani joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Aisha, Halliru and Sumaiya. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tijani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tijani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Tijani spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is 48-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Marneuli district with her husband and son. Her husband is a taxi driver and serves local people to earn income. The family is involved is agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow potatoes to sell. 

Gulzar wants to open a tea house. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,000 Gel. With the received credit, Gulzar will purchase the inventory and all the needed things to open a tea house. She will serve all her clients and will offer different types of tea. She will be involved in her own business and will have stable income. Gulzar awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a tea house and start a cafe business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en:
Anjeline is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Tata

texts.en:
Tata is a maize farmer from Ango village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tata would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tata can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Tata, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 42 years old. She is married with five children aged between 10 and 23 years; all of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in a business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and rice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice to resell.

loans.name: Sougrenom Wend Group

texts.fr:
Madame JUSTINE KISWENSIDA est la représentante du groupe SOUGRENOM WEND. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 17 ans et le moins âgé à 14ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes en charge. 
Madame vend des fruits et des gâteaux depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de fruit.
 Elle veut s’acheter 05 cartons de bananes, 02 cartons de pommes.
Madame compte utiliser ces bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce et contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante et ouvrir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Madame Justine Kiswensida is the representative of the group called Sougrenom Wend. She is the married mother of two children. The older is 17 and the younger is 14. Both attend school. Justine is responsible for seven persons. 

Justine has been selling fruit and cakes for 15 years. She buys her fruit in the fruit market. She wants to buy 5 cases of bananas and 2 cases of apples. 

She intends to use her profit to grow her business and contribute to covering family expenses. Her ambition is to become a big businesswoman and open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy five cases of bananas and two cases of apples

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira is a 39-year-old, married woman with two children. She has a kind husband who loves them. Her husband is a master, but his salary is insufficient to cover the family's needs. They provide for their family by growing different fruit trees in her garden.

Gulmira has good experience in this business. She sells her crops at a local bazaar and her income from this business is AZN 120 (manat). 

But, her situation is very hard. She needs to raise vegetables and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes this a problem. Because of this problem, productivity has fallen, and she cannot cover the family’s needs. 

Gulmira has applied for an AZN 1,500 loan in order to be able to supply water to her garden weekly. This will increase productivity again and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina de 39 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad desde hace vario años, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared, cambiando el techo y colocando piso cerámico, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Evangelina is 39 years old and has been working selling basic needs items for a number of years. She lives in her own house with her family. She wants to make improvements on her house constructing a wall, replacing the roof and laying ceramic tile. But what she makes from her sales doesn't cover the cost so she is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, laminate sheeting, beams and pay for labor so that she and her family can live in more security and comfort.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, laminated sheeting, beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Darwin Alexis

texts.es:
El señor Darwin  tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa tiene casa propia y sus hijas que  dependen de él, vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras y se dedica desde hace  20  años a la Agricultura.
Don Darwin está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cerdos para, con el préstamo el  espera tener su pequeña granja y que mejoren sus ingresos para poder seguir apoyando a su familia.

 Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Darwin is 40 years old and lives with his wife. He has his own house, and daughters who are his dependents. He lives in the Trojes community, in the east of Honduras, and has worked in agriculture for twenty years.

Darwin is asking for a loan so that he can buy pigs, as he hopes to have his own small farm with the loan, which will improve his income and allow him to continue supporting his family.

Trojes, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Zhanargul

texts.ru: Жанаргул, 37 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Жанаргул высшее образование, она много лет проработала в школе, сейчас в декретном отпуске. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. У Жанаргул в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 1 лошадь. На земельном участке мерою 0,73 ГА она выращивает ячмень. Жанаргул известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Жанаргул планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Zhanargul is 37 years old, married and has three children. Zhanargul has a higher education. For many years, she worked at an elementary school. Now she is on maternity leave. As an additional source of income for her family, she practices farming. Zhanargul has 4 cows and 1 horse on her farm. She also has a 0.73 hectare plot of land on which she grows barley. Zhanargul is well known as a principled, honest, respectable and trustworthy person. For the further development of her business, Zhanargul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. Zhanargul plans to use the income from the loan for the further development of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Lilashah Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Mayaben, the lady in the center (and the group leader), hails from Kutch, Gujarat. She runs her own small business supplying tiffins within her neighborhood. She buys fresh ingredients from the market, cooks delicious healthy meals, and delivers them as packed lunches to her customers. Through this, she earns a monthly income of Rs. 5,000, which, put together with her husband’s income of Rs. 7,000, is used to cover living expenses for her family. Her household of five includes her teenaged child; they live in the Kutch district of Gujarat, in western India.

Maya, who did not go to school due to poverty, wants to ensure that she can give her child access to a life better than hers through education. But with a household savings of Rs. 2,000 this seems to be an impossible task. 

Maya has come together with a group of women to crowdsource a loan of Rs. 75,000. With her share of the loan, Maya will expand and grow her tiffin business, allowing her to reach out to more customers and increase her household income by 60 percent. She will be able to buy more ingredients and produce, and take on more orders. As business grows, she may even hire a helper to cater to more orders. With the projected increase in business, she stands to net an additional Rs. 8,000 a month. She will invest about 35-40 percent of this back into growing her business further, so that its growth becomes self-sustaining. The rest, she will take home as personal savings.

Like Maya, group members Pusphaben, Soniyaben, Sushila, and Kalavati are all married with children and looking to start or grow their own respective petty shop, cloth selling, and papad making microenterprises. 

All these women seek the loan to make their households more financially stable and provide an education for their children, something they never had access to. Your loan will empower five hardworking, industrious women to secure their children’s future. Mayaben, in particular, expresses her gratitude for your support and this opportunity.

loans.use: to grow her small-scale tiffin services business of providing ready packed lunches to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and iron sheets to make a new roof for the house.

loans.name: Alh. Kasimu

texts.en: Alh. Kasimu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Kasimu would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Kasimu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Alh. Kasimu is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 50 years old. She is married with two children aged 17 and 20 years, and all of them go to school. 

Fatuma sells shoes and has been in this business for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de utensilios para el salón de belleza, como champú, maquillaje, tintes, maquinas de peluquear entre otros. Con esto espera poder hacer más clientes y dar un mejor  servicio y obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia  y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children, who are her greatest priority. 

With this loan, Silvia intends to buy the supplies for her beauty salon, including shampoo, make up, hair dyes and hairdressing tools among other things. By making these purchases, Silvia hopes to gain more clients, provide an improved service and make a little more money. In this way, Silvia can improve her living conditions of her family, as well as achieve some other goals. 

This is the first loan that Silvia has received from FUDECOSUR. Silvia has never had a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy stock for a beauty salon

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives in their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty and hair products for his barber shop that he uses on a daily basis.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 26 years old and married. She sells clothes, which she has been doing for three years, to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. Hanan is a hard worker who has a good reputation among her customers. 

Hanan requested a youth loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs. With the loan, her income will increase and her living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a maize farmer from Lumu village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Sarah would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sarah can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Sarah, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Katsinawa Fulani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and he hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 28 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 5, 3 y 1 años de edad. Él es trabajador y se gana la vida con su negocio de alquiler de computadoras, en el cual también busca información en internet para tener más y mejores ingresos económicos. Luis desea construir una galera en su vivienda, ya que cuando llueve el agua se filtra en la galera que tiene actualmente, porque como se observa en la fotografía el techo tiene orificios grandes, que ya no permiten que Luis tenga la protección adecuada en su vivienda, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para para construir una galera que remplace la que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Luis is a 28-year-old man who resides in his own home along with his life companion and their three children (ages 5, 3, and 1). He is hard worker who earns his living through his business of renting out computers. Luis also conducts Internet searches for a fee so that he can generate additional income.

He wants to build a shed for his home. When it rains, water seeps into the shed that he currently has, which is shown in the photograph. The roof of the shed has large holes, so it does not provide adequate protection. For this reason, Luis is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails so that he can build a new shed to replace the existing one.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails so that he can build a new shed for his home.

loans.name: El Maguey Group

texts.es:
Escondida entre cañales, frente al panteón y la orilla de la carretera principal se encuentra el barrio donde se formó el grupo El Maguey, nombre que los clientes eligieron por la magnitud de la planta del maguey, porque de la misma manera esperan crecer y producir ganancias con sus actividades: 

Yolanda- Refrescos
Aracely- Ropa
Aidee- Ropa Interior
Primitiva- Panaderia
Angelina- Pan 
Francisca- Zapatos 
Vanessa- Abarrotes

Doña Primitiva es madre de dos chicos, es casada y desde hace dos años a diario se escucha música en su casa con un motivo distinto; ya son dos años los que tiene de experiencia en la elaboración y venta de pan. Hoy en día 19 personas trabajan con ella, de los cuales 12 son repartidores y los 7 restantes se dedican hacer el pan. En la panadería todo el día hay risas, cantos, pláticas mientras trabajan la masa, encienden el horno, preparan las charolas, los canastos, para tener listas las conchas, caprichos, cuernos, laureles y muchos otros tipos de pan. 

Para doña Primitiva es muy importante convivir con sus empleados crear un mejor ambiente. Todos los días, a las 3 pm el pan está listo y ella comienza a contar las piezas que carga cada uno de los vendedores. De las tres panaderías que hay en el barrio, la de ella es la más productiva por el sabor ya que utiliza un horno de piedra y leña. Los empleados, entre risas y bromas dicen que el mejor ingrediente es el amor con que hornean el pan, estar contentos mientras trabajan y sentirse motivados.

Primitiva invertirá el préstamo en la compra de  harina, leña, manteca vegetal, azúcar, colorante natural, ajonjolí, queso, bolsas de papel, charolas,  comenta que las ganancias al préstamo de igual manera las invierte en la compra de harina, manteca, leña, azúcar, papel de estraza. Con sus ganancias ha reconstruido una de las paredes de la panadería “Espero prontamente poder construir las dos paredes que aun son de madera”.

“Muchos me preguntan cuál es el secreto de mi éxito y siempre contesto aprender a no mortificarme por cosas que no valen la pena”

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Primitiva quien tiene un leño en la mano, las integrantes están paradas delante de una carga de leña utilizada para la cocción del pan.
texts.en:
Hidden among canals, in front of the cemetery and at the edge of the main highway is the neighborhood where El Maguey was formed. This name was chosen by its members because of the strength of the maguey plant, as members hope to grow and produce profits with their activities in the same way:

Yolanda- Beverages
Aracely- Clothing
Aidee- Intimate wear
Primitiva- Bakery
Angelina- Bread
Vanessa- Groceries

Primitiva is the mother of two children, is married and for the past two years she listens to music in her home everyday with a different theme. She already has two years of experience with the production and sale of bread. Currently 19 people work with her, 12 of whom are deliverymen and the remaining 7 who work to make the bread. All day in the bakery there is laughter, singing, and chatter while working the dough, turning on the oven, and preparing the trays and baskets in order to make ready conchas, caprichos, cuernos, laureles and many other types of bread.

For Primitiva it is very important to get along with her employees to create a better work environment. Everyday at 3 p.m., the bread is ready and she begins to count the pieces that each seller is responsible for. Of the three bakeries that are in the neighborhood, hers is the most popular for its taste because a wood-burning stove is used. The employees, while laughing and joking, say that the best ingredient is the love with which the bread is baked, to be happy at work and to feel motivated. 

Primitiva will invest the loan to buy flour, firewood, vegetable shortening, sugar, natural dye, sesame, cheese, paper bags, and trays. She states that profits from the loan will equally be invested to purchase flour, butter, firewood, sugar, and brown paper. With her profits she has reconstructed one of the walls of the bakery. She says, "I hope to soon be able to build the two walls that are still made of wood."

"Many have asked me what is the secret to my success and I always respond to learn to not bother myself with things that are not worth it."

*The photograph was taken in the house of Primitiva, who is holding the log. The members are standing in front of a load of wood used for making bread.

loans.use: To buy flour, firewood, vegetable shortening, sugar, natural dye, sesame, cheese, paper bags and trays

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María, vende sorbetes y paletas de sabores, vive con su compañero de vida, sus hijos ya son independientes y le ayudan un poco económicamente; su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante en su vehículo, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 am. a  4:00 p.m., el negocio nació hace más de 5 años por necesidad de cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de sorbete y paletas de saberes para mejorar el inventario del negocio, continuara trabajando y tendrá ingresos para resarcir su deuda y hacerle reparaciones al vehículo.
Las aspiraciones de María son comprar la propiedad en donde vive actualmente y establecer un negocio fijo.
texts.en:
Maria sells sorbets and ice pops. She lives with her life partner. Her children are already independent and they help her a little financially.

She sells on the streets from her vehicle, and her work hours are from 8 am to 4 pm. She started this business over five years ago out of the need to cover household expenses. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of sorbets and ice pops to improve her product stock. 

She will continue working to generate income in order to repay her debt and repair her vehicle.

Maria aims to buy the property where she currently lives and to set up her business to sell from a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy sorbets and ice pops to improve her product stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Pablo es un joven trabajador, tiene 3 hijos de 4,5,Y 11 años de edad, el es un joven trabajador de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y la madre de sus hijos tiene una tercena, Pablo se  dedica unos 5 años a la agricultura, el crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, fungicidas y para pago de mano de obra, ya que el paga  a las personas que se dedican al jornal para que le ayuden a tener sanos sus cultivos y así lograr una buena cosecha y seguir trabajando para darles todo lo necesario para que sus hijos siga adelante en sus estudios y forjen un buen futuro.
texts.en: Pablo is a young worker.  He has three children who are 4- 5- and 11-years old respectively.  He makes his living in agriculture.  His children's mother has a butcher shop.  Pablo has dedicated himself to agriculture for the last five years.  He needs the loan to purchase compost, fungicides and to pay for labor, as he pays day laborers to help him have a healthy crop and a good harvest.  The loan will allow him to keep working so he can give his children everything they need to move forward in their education and build a decent future.

loans.use: to purchase compost.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Estrellas debe su nombre al gusto que tienen los integrantes por los astros que iluminan el cielo. Para llegar a lo comunidad donde viven, se debe seguir un pequeño camino de terracería que se encuentra entre plantaciones de caña y las chimeneas de fábricas de azúcar. Las personas que conforman el grupo y sus actividades productivas son:

Humberta- Abarrotes
Dora-Antojitos 
Maricela- Pollo
Antolina-Abarrotes
Ana Yazmin- Medicamento Naturista
Maria- Calzado por catalogo
Ana- Estética
Soledad- Pollo

Doña Humberta es madre de 2 hijas quienes dependen económicamente de ella, está casada con el Señor Roque y desde hace algunos años ha dedicado su tiempo a la venta de abarrotes siendo su madre la máxima inspiración para iniciar con dicha actividad. Esta es la segunda ocasión que Humberta solicita un crédito y así como el anterior necesita invertir en arroz, frijol, sopa, azúcar, huevos, galletas, botanas y refrescos pues son lo productos con mayor demanda en su tiendita. 

Además, Humberta tiene una segunda actividad, cada 15 días prepara los tradicionales tamales mexicanos para vender. Los tamales son pequeños pasteles de masa de maíz envueltos con hojas de plátano o de maíz. Humberta utiliza las mismas hojas que están en su patio.

"Gracias por depositar su confianza en cada una de las integrantes del grupo y hacer posible nuestros sueños de crecer con nuestra actividad".

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Antolina, doña Humberta viste blusa a rayas y pantalón rojo.
texts.en:
The "Las Estrellas" group owes it's name to the enjoyment that the members get from the stars that illuminate the skies. To get to their community you have to follow a small dirt road that goes between sugar plantations and sugar factory chimneys. The people that make up the group and their businesses are:

Humberta- groceries
Dora- snacks
Maricela- chicken
Antolina- groceries
Ana Yazmin- natural medicine
Maria- footwear from catalogs
Ana- beauty services
Soledad- chicken

Humberta is mother to two children who are dependent on her, She is married to Roque. For a number of years she has been spending her time selling groceries, her mother being her main inspiration for starting this business.

This is the second time Humberta has requested a loan and as with the last one she will invest in rice, beans, soup, sugar, eggs, biscuits, snacks and soft drinks as these are the product most in demand in her store.

Humberta has a second business. Every fortnight she prepares traditional Mexican tamales to sell. The tamales are small pastries make with corn flour wrapped in a banana or corn leaf. Humberta uses the leaves found in her yard.

"Thank you for putting your faith in each member of our group and make it possible for our dreams to grow through our businesses". The photo was taken in Antolina's yard. Humberta is wearing the striped blouse and red pants.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soup, sugar, eggs, biscuits, snacks and soft drinks.

location.town: COL. PALMA SOLA MUNICIPIO OMEALCA VERACRUZ

loans.name: Gulira

texts.ru: Гулира успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулиры есть 4 коровы, 20 овец и 2 лошади. На земельном участке мерою 1,92 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). Гулира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков и жеребенка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Gulira successfully paid back her previous loan, using it for it's designated purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and to all those who funded her previous loan. Gulira currently has 4 cows, 20 sheep and 2 horses on her farm. She also has a 1.92 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans for sale. Her average monthly cumulative income is 16,000 som (KGS). Gulira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy 2 bull calves and 2 colts to increase the size of her herd. Gulira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plans to save money to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy two bull-calves and colts to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Umidahon

texts.ru: Умидахон 43 года, замужем, есть 4 детей, младший школьного возраста. У Умидахон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей женской одеждой и нижним бельем, стартовав 10 лет назад. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Умидахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения ассортимента товара. Доходы от кредита Умидахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Umidahon is 43 years old, married and has four children, the youngest of whom attends elementary school. Umidahon has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she sells women's clothing and underwear. She started this business 10 years ago. She currently has an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Umidahon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 30,000 som (KGS) to increase her assortment of merchandise. Umidahon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plans to save money to make home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes and underwear for retail sale.

loans.name: Davis

texts.en: Davis is a 54-year-old man with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to help him boost his real estate business. He will buy a piece of land that will appreciate in a year, and then sell it at a profit. His challenge is that his business is located in a rural area with low income earners, who still buy at relatively low prices. Davis thanks the Kiva lenders, through UGAFODE, for supporting small entrepreneurs.
