He believes that with a financial boost, his business will expand, and he will be able to provide employment to the unemployed youth. He is hard working and focused. Pictured is Davis(center), his wife, and a UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena tiene la edad  de 42 años, está divorciada, vive con una hija  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de ropa al por mayor para que le salga mas cómoda, ella quiere comprar ropa para niños, mujeres y ropa interior esto para revenderla y así poder obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia  y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lorena is 42 years old, divorced and lives with her daughter, who is her greatest priority.

With this loan, Lorena intends to buy clothes wholesale, she wants to buy clothing for children, women and underwear to resell, and thus make a little money and improve the living conditions of her family, as well as achieve some other goals.

This is the first loan that Lorena has received from FUDECOSUR. Lorena has never had a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Colquepatha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLQUEPATHA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maribel es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de regalos, venta de comida, venta de enaguas, venta de coca, venta de salchipapas, venta de verduras, venta de pantalones, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maribel es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de prendas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia, al observar el amplio mercado decide estudiar en un instituto técnico la elaboración de estos productos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros  que ofrece la institución, ya que le ayudo a conseguir su sueño.
texts.en:
Colquepatha Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Maribel is the secretary.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of jobs, including gift sales, food sales, skirt sales, coca sales, salchipapa [sausage and potato] sales, vegetable sales, pants sales, and blanket sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Maribel.  She said it's the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently she has a business sewing garments.  She said she started the business several years ago on her own initiative.  She decided to study sewing in a technical institute when she saw the wide market for it.

The loan Maribel's getting is to increase her capital with the purchase of a machine from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  Later she'll make sales in her sales stall.  This job allows her to earn income to support her family, because she's single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the savings the institution offers, because it helped her to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy a machine

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana de 36 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace varios años, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo dos cuartos en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, hierros, ladrillos, y pago de mano de obra para que ella y sus hijos puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Ana is 36 years old and has worked growing basic grains for several years. She lives in her own house with her 3 daughters. She wants to make improvements on her house by constructing two rooms in the place shown in the photograph. She does not have sufficient capital to do this so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy cement, sand, re-bar and pay for labor so that she and her daughters can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, re-bar, bricks and pay for labor.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 45-year-old Syrian citizen, a married father of three children, who has been selling plastic cups, plates, forks, knives, spoons, and many other plastic items necessary for several occasions since April 2010.

He has a long experience in this domain since 1983. He was only fourteen years old when he had to quit school and work hard to support his family in their living expenses.

Today, Khaled is working hard to make sure that his children will have a better childhood; thus, developing his business is his main aim to achieve his plans.

That's why his loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in increasing his business merchandise especially for the coming Christmas and New Year celebration, in addition to special occasion themes.

He hopes that in the future he can develop his business more to open a wholesale trade shop.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise especially for the coming Christmas and New Year celebrations.

loans.name: Usman Luka

texts.en:
Usman Luka is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Usman Luka would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman Luka can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Usman Luka is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 30-year-old, married woman, and the mother of 2 children. She has been doing business purchasing and selling animals sale for many years, with the support of her husband. Tahira fully supports and assists her husband in meeting their household expenses. In order to expand her business, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more animals to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to resell in the market to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Jantrix

texts.en:
Jantrix is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, Jantrix has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES Jantrix wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim (shown in photo) is 58 years old, a widow, and lives at Keansvay district along the Mekong River.

She has been married since 1979 and has three sons and five daughters. Five are married and two are garment workers and the last one has studied.

Lim has been a farm worker in her village for four years, while her daughters are garment workers with two years' in experience. Now Lim would like to apply for a loan to purchase a new motorbike to take her daughters to work.

She hopes strongly that after she has the motorbike it will be easier to take them to work.

loans.use: To buy a new motor bike.

loans.name: Maria  Fidelia

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los diferentes mercados, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 56, lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She has made a living selling corn for several years. When the harvest is ready, she stores it in the graineries shown in the photo so she can later sell it in different markets.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, infestation control, and other items.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, infestation control, and other items.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 43 years old. He is married with two children aged three and five years; one of them goes to school. 

Innocent has a supermarket and has been in business for seven years. With the loan, he would like to buy milk, bread and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy milk, bread and juice to sell

loans.name: Sa'ade

texts.en: Sa'ade is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sa'ade joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Sa'ade would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sa'ade can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sa'ade  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a 30-year-old married man, with 2 children. He lives in a rural setting with his children, and also takes care of his mother, since she is very old. He deals in the agricultural business, where he grows matoke and coffee on a large scale. Vicent also runs a retail shop as a side business. He started the business in 2003.

Vicent works 6 days a week and 12 hours per day, and started his business because it was easy and profitable. Vicent acquired this loan to improve his matoke and coffee plantations by buying fertilizers and pesticides. His clients are traders in his village, and those from the city.
Vicent's future hope is to be the leading supplier of matoke and quality coffee in his village. The challenges he faces are poor weather conditions, and pests and diseases that attack the crops. He has to spend a lot of money to spray, which hinders the growth of his business. He describes himself as a honest and hard-working man, who appreciates the services lenders are providing to the people.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 35-year-old, hard-working lady. She has a business purchasing and selling animals. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. Shazia is very motivated to contribute to the family income. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. Shazia is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers, and to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Urkupiña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “URKUPIÑA” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fanny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de juguetes americanos, tienda de barrio, venta de chatarra y plástico, taller de carpintería, venta de medias, taller de costura, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fanny es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa de su familia, quienes le enseñaron la técnica, con el pasar del tiempo ella continuo con el mismo negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pescado por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "URKUPIÑA" will commence its eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is comprised of eight members and and is managed by a board of directors of which Fanny is the president. The businesses operated by the members of the community association are numerous and include: the sale of American toys, a neighborhood store, the sale of scrap metal and plastic, a woodworking shop, the sale of socks, a tailor, and the sale of fish. 

The loan that will be taken out will benefit the group of small microentrepreneurs of which Fanny is a member. She says that she has participated in Pro Mujer for five years, joining on invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling fish; she states that the business was established many years ago by her family, who taught her the technique. With the passage of time she continued the business. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (to buy fish wholesale) that is obtained from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, and afterwards she will sell the fish in her own place of business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 36 years. She is single and blessed with two children of 16 and 2 years. 

She sells clothes, a business she has done for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 6,000.

Edith has requested her thirrd loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 30,000, which she will use to purchase new handbags, baby clothes, and shoes for selling, especially during this Christmas season when parents are buying new clothes for their children.

With the anticipated profits, Edith will be able to expand her business even further. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and provide the best for them in life.

loans.use: to purchase new handbags, baby clothes and shoes for selling

loans.name: Sadiqa

texts.en: Sadiqa is a 35-year-old married woman. She runs a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffalo and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Sadiqa’s job is to look after the buffalo and collect the milk from them. Together, both Sadiqa and her husband are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Sadiqa  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo, so that she can cater to more customers, and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado por vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una peluquería ubicada cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, el joven vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de  maquinas para quitar barba, talcos, gelatinas, etc. y asi seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
This young man’s face has been blurred because he lives in a high-risk area. He runs a barber shop at home and has many clients because he does a good job. He lives with his two children in a house of his own.

He is requesting a loan to buy razors, talcum powder, hair gel, etc. and continue with his activity, which is profitable.

loans.use: to buy razors, talcum powder, hair gel, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 61-year-old married mother of 14 children. Her husband does not work due to health problems, thus she is the sole earner of her family. She has had a small convenience store since 1994, and sells canned food, cleaning detergents, chocolates, sweets, soft drinks, chips, cereals, and grains.

Today Amina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by increasing the merchandise with special winter requested items to satisfy her customers during this cold season.

Amina hopes to stay in good health to remain capable of running her own business and making a living.

loans.use: to develop her business by increasing the merchandise with special winter requested items to satisfy her customers during this cold season

loans.name: Zoila Marina

texts.es: Zoila de 58 años de edad posee un molino de nixtamal desde hace varios años, vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando el techo, piso y puertas en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, puertas balcones, polines, piso cerámico, cemento y pago de mano de obra, para que ella y su esposo puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Zoila is 58 years old and has owned a corn mill for many years. She lives in her own home with her husband. She wants to improve her home by putting in a roof, floor and doors in the place shown in the photograph, but with the money she earns from her job she is not able to achieve this. Therefore she is applying for a loan to purchase sheets, balcony doors, machinery, ceramic flooring, cement and labor, so that she and her husband can live more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy sheets, balcony doors, machinery, cement and labor

loans.name: Ilir

texts.en:
Ilir wants to thank all of the lenders for their support, and for giving him the opportunity to expand his business and income. With the loan he was given, he was able to purchase some materials to expand his second greenhouse and increase his business. Thanks to this, his business continues to thrive and be successful. 

Now he is requesting a second loan to continue to further expand his business, build another greenhouse, and purchase seeds. He appreciates the continued support.

loans.use: To continue to further expand his business, build another greenhouse, and purchase seeds

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio es un hombre de 28 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 28 años, ya que su vivienda es una herencia familiar en la que nació y se ha criado. Él es un hombre luchador que demuestra su entereza y tenacidad saliendo adelante con su pequeña negocio de elaboración y venta de pan la cual realiza desde hace 4 años. Julio desea realizar mejoras en el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polín "c", y pines para mejorar el techo de su vivienda aprovechando que la temporada de lluvias ha terminado.
texts.en: Julio, 28, has lived all his life in his family home, where he was born and raised. He never gives up in the face of hardship and this quality shows in the way he manages to make a living out of his small business, which consists in baking and selling bread. He is a very honest man and has been in business for four years. Julio wishes to repair the roof of his house, which is currently in a sorry state. Thus, he asks FUSAI for a loan in order to buy the following: galvanised steel sheets, wooden 'C' beams and screws. Julio will take advantage of the end of the rainy season to use these materials to repair the roof.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Alh Gambo

texts.en:
Alh Gambo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh Gambo would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh Gambo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Alh Gambo expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nuhu A

texts.en:
Nuhu A is a maize farmer from Katselle village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu A would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu A can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Nuhu A, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zam Zam Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, who is in her late twenties, is a divorcee with one kid who is still in school. She has been running a beauty salon for four years now. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaisha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy salon products and meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of opening another salon.

Mwanaisha will share this loan with "Zam Zam" group, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon products and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Lucio Juan

texts.es:
Lucio es un hombre de 53 años de edad, casado, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de cereales.
El es emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ una área caracterizada por la feria los días jueves y domingos, donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser ropa hasta un tractor para sembrar la tierra. De clima frío (4-12 grados centígrados) y rayos solares muy fuertes que pueden quemar la piel, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Lucio es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la venta de cereales como; semillas de chía y cocoa. Labor que realiza en diferentes ciudades viajando por temporadas para distribuir sus productos a sus clientes. Las semillas de chía son muy consumidas debido a sus beneficios en aminoácidos y a su cantidad de proteína. Y la Cocoa es muy consumida en especial en esta época del año donde se realizan bastantes festejos infantiles y proponiendo a la cocoa como alimento central que es acompañado con galletas o simplemente pan. “las semillas de chía tienen mucha demanda, cada vez más la gente las compra por sus aportes nutricionales…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante y preparar comida vegetariana y dietética. Él desea realizar la compra por mayor de cereales y semillas para ofertar a  fin de año y tener un gran stock almacenado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lucio solicita un préstamo para la compra de cereales y semillas por mayor para distribuirlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucio, 53, is married and has no children.  His business is selling cereals.  He's an enterprising, independent, persevering, responsible, and hardworking man.  He works in the 16 de Julio area, known for its market on Thursday and Sunday, where you can find anything--from a needle for sewing clothing to a tractor for sowing the land.  The climate is cold (4-12 degrees centigrade), the sun rays are so strong they can burn the skin, and the average altitude is 3,800 meters above sea level.

Lucio is short and dark, and has short black hair.  His native language is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for everyday use and for business.  He lives with his wife, who works in the same business.  They live in their own home, a brick house with potable water, electricity, and gas.

His business is selling cereals such as chia seeds and cocoa, traveling seasonally to different cities to distribute his products to his customers.  Chia seeds are consumed a lot because of the benefits of their amino acids and the amount of protein.  Cocoa is consumed especially frequently this time of year when there are a lot of children's celebrations, and it's presented as a main food to accompany cookies or just bread.  "Chia seeds are in high demand.  People buy them more all the time because of their nutritional value," he said.

Lucio wants to buy cereals and seeds wholesale to sell at the end of the year and have a big supply on hand to distribute to his customers.  This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 20 years he has been in this line of work.

His dream is to have a restaurant and make vegetarian and low-calorie food.

loans.use: to buy cereals and seeds wholesale to distribute to his customers

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 40 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras es padre de 3 hijos y se dedica al comercio como ser el engorde de Cerdos.
Don José cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más cerditos para engordarlos y después revenderlos, espera que esta inversión le ayuda a salir adelante en su negocio.   
Uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de educar a sus hijos. 


Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old, lives in the community of Trojes, in the east of Honduras and has three children. 

José makes a living raising piglets, he has been doing this for over 10 years. He is requesting a loan to buy more piglets in order to fatten them up and afterwards resell them. José hopes that this investment with help him to move forward with his business. One of his dreams is to be able to educate his children. 

Trojes, Honduras, November 2014.

loans.use: to buy piglets for his business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 28-year-old, married woman. She lives in Zestaponi district with her husband and pensioner parents-in-law. The only source of income for the 4-member family is her husband's monthly salary, which is not enough. 

Irma got engaged at a young age and she does not have a university degree. She is unemployed. 

She has decided to start her own business and has requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to start a trading business. Irma will purchase a stock of clothes to resell, in order to generate income.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes to generate a stable income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more home appliances to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives at their own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 52-year-old Palestinian refugee, and a married father of three children. He has run a small cafe since January 2014, with experience since 1975, where he used to work with his father at the age of 13. Youssef is very talented in his domain, and his cafe is well known in his region with his cleanliness and the special customer service provided. In addition to coffee and hot drinks, Youssef also provides his customers special juices and cocktails that attract their attention.

Today, Youssef is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a used espresso machine with an encouraging price, to provide a tasty espresso, highly requested by most of his customers. He hopes that in the future he can buy his own shop and save rental fees.

loans.use: to buy a used espresso machine for a good price, to provide a tasty espresso, highly requested by most of his customers.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne 43 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire. SALI, 1ère assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20Litres d’huile, 5 paniers de tomates fraîches, 5 boîtes de concentrée de tomate, 10Kg de poivre, 5 paquets de Cube Maggi, 30Kg de poisson frais, 15Kg de poisson fumé et 25Kg de Sel. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the DANAYA group are women who average 43 years of age and six children each. They all live in extended traditional families in LAFIABOUGOU, a district of SAN/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

These women share ties of kinship. They buy and sell condiments and various other products. 

Having repaid their previous loans without incident, they are now in their 8th group loan cycle. SALI, sitting first from the left in the group photo, plans to use her loan to buy 20 liters of oil, 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 5 tins of condensed tomato, 10 kg of pepper, 5 packages of Maggi bouillon cubes, 30 kg of fresh fish, 15 kg of smoked fish, and 25 kg of salt. She buys her stock from local wholesalers, and she sells to a clientele consisting of men and women, cash or credit. 

Sali expects to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000FCFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare, clothing and tuition. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy fish and condiments.

loans.name: Chirstine

texts.en:
Chirstine is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is a strong woman. She was born in 1978 in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has four children.

She has had a business for about fourteen years. She buys cattle for additional income from livestock sellers. Her business is feeding livestock and she has 12 horned cattle. She sells her cattle twice a month. She has ground where she plants forage for cattle.

Gulbahor needs financial support for buying livestock to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy livestock to enlarge her business

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Gloria es una señora de 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, las edades de  ellos están en 8, 11 y 14 años de edad mismos que están estudiando, el esposo de Gloria trabaja en cultivo de flores en una planta florícola, Gloria se dedica a la crianza de  animales menores, el crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus  ingresos, la aspiración de Gloria es seguir en su negocio y trabajar duro para bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old and married with 3 children. Their ages are 8, 11 and 14, all of whom are studying. Gloria's husband works growing flowers at a floricultural plant and Gloria makes a living raising young animals. 


The loan will be used to buy pigs to improve her business and thus her revenues. Gloria's aspiration is to continue her business and work hard for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 43 years old and she lives in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. Anush is married and she has a son. Anush has a vocational education with a specialty in accountancy. For many years she worked in her specialty but now she is unemployed. Anush’s husband works as a driver, but he helps his wife greatly with farming and agriculture, in which Anush is seriously engaged.

On her farm Anush has 2 cows, a pig and 2 sheep. She has regular customers for her farm milk, butter and cheese which she makes herself. On her land she mainly cultivates potatoes and sells from her house to re-sellers.

She will use this loan for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also animal fodder for her all farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also animal fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Ronal

texts.es: Ronal es conductor de radio taxi y vive en la ciudad de La Paz, tiene siete hijos pero esta separado de la esposa. Su ocupación lo mantiene alejado de su familia porque debe trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. Ronal quiere un credito para hacer una reparacion en su vehiculo, lo que pasa es que Ronal trabaja mucho y el carro no es nuevo, lo que ha ocasionado una falla que debe ser reparada, caso contrario, Ronal se queda sin ingresose, el vehiculo sigue siendo su única herramienta de trabajo. Al menos ningun miembro de su familia esta enfermo y Ronal goza de buena salud, se recomienda ayudarlo porque anteriormente ha rendido bien en Kiva
texts.en:
Ronal is a radio taxi driver. He lives in the city of La Paz and has seven children, though he's separated from his wife. His job keeps him away from his family because he has to work late into the night. 

Ronal wants a loan to make a repair on his vehicle. What happens is that Ronal works a lot and the car isn't new, which has caused a fault that needs to be repaired. Otherwise, Ronal will be without income - the vehicle continues to be his only work tool. 

At least none of his family members are sick and Ronal is in good health. It's recommended to help him because he previously did well with Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Grace operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Mom is 40 years old and a mother of two young children. For her living, she grows rice as the main source of income and plants tobacco as a supplemental income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 31,900 KHR per day.

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. In a group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy more tobacco to support her tobacco farm.

She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her business bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to support her tobacco farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Aichurek

texts.ru: Айчурек, 55 лет, замужем, многодетная мать 4 детей, дети взрослые, младший сын живет с родителями, остальные - отдельно. У Айчурек среднее образование, много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 4 дойные коровы, 2 бычка и 9 овец. На ежедневной основе Айчурек продает экологически чистое домашнее молоко. Также на участке мерою 10,0 ГА, она выращивает клевер и ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айчурек обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена и корма для скота, что позволит ей сохранить поголовье скота и получить весной здоровый приплод. Доходы от кредита позволят Айчурек развить ее бизнес и накопить средства на покупку породистых коров.
texts.en: Aichurek is 55 years old, married and a mother of 4 children, all of whom are grown. The youngest son lives with the parents, and the rest live separately. Aichurek has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for many years. Today, her farm contains 4 dairy cows, 2 bulls and 9 sheep. Aichurek sells ecologically-clean, home-made milk on a daily basis. She also grows clover and barley on 10.0 hectares of land for the household consumption and sale. In order to further develop her business, Aichurek requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy hay and livestock feed, which will help her retain her livestock headcount and get healthy offspring in the spring. The earnings from the loan will allow Aichurek to develop her business and save money to buy purebred cows.

loans.use: to buy hay and livestock feed

loans.name: Perseverante Group

texts.es:
Gilka es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan y masitas típicas.
Ella es sensible, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizado por ser el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, y por el comercio que realizan los descendientes de inmigrantes de etnias del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados de occidente, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Gilka es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la segunda de la izquierda, usa pantalón celeste y chaqueta blanca). Vive en casa de sus padres que está construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de crecer en su negocio formó una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de transporte, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores y servicio de té, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan y masitas típicas, como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Zonzo (Puré de yuca mezclado con queso y formado en un palito para cocinarse al horno), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), Masaco de plátano (Plátano de freír aplastado y mezclado con queso, cerdo o charque de res). "Fue mi madre de quien aprendí el oficio y ahora administro mi negocio. Me enseñó todos los secretos…" comenta. Su sueño es tener una panadería propia en un lugar fijo para ya no tener que vender ambulando. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de materiales de panadería, como; Cuchara plástica: se necesita una cuchara para mezclar harina y levadura. Bowls de acero inoxidable: para las masas. Se utilizan con tapa para masas madre. Raspador de masa: vital para quitar la masa pegada. Balanza de precisión: Imprescindible pesar los ingredientes con medidas exactas y en pequeñas cantidades. Jarra medidora: Una jarra con marcas visibles es muy útil para medir los líquidos. Cucharas medidoras: para tener ingredientes con la medida justa. Rodillo: se utilizan para estirar la masa, y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gilka solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de panadería, para elaborar masitas tradicionales.
texts.en:
Gilka, 23, is single and has no children. She makes and sells bread and traditional pastries.
She is sensitive, honest, generous, sympathetic, responsible and hard-working. She works in the neighbourhood 'Plan 3000', the most populated area in town. This neighbourhood is known for being a trading hub for the descendants of immigrants of ethnic minorities, such as the Ayoreos, and for relocated miners from the West of the country. Here, the weather is hot and humid, tropical indeed, with a constant temperature of 30 degrees Celsius the whole year round.
Gilka is dark-skinned and wears her long black hair in a ponytail. She is not very tall. Her mother tongue is guaraní; she learned Spanish by hearing people speak it around her and by speaking with her customers. In the picture, she is the second person from the left, sporting jeans and a white jacket. She lives at her parents' house, which is made of brick. It has drinking water and electricity and is connected to the sewer system. Gilka saw the need to make her business grow and thus gathered people to create a communal bank. The members have varied occupations, such as: providing transportation services, selling videos, selling crockery, selling mobile phones, selling chicken meat, selling flowers and owning a tea room. The aim of the group is to ask for a loan in order to improve their businesses. Gilka makes and sells bread and traditional pastries, such as: cuñapés (a small bun made of yuca flour mixed with cheese), rice empanadas (made in the oven with rice and cheese), zonzos (mashed yuca mixed with cheese, moulded into a cylindrical shape, and baked in the oven), wheat buns (hard balls of wheat flour), plantain purée (mashed plantains mixed with cheese, pork, or beef jerky). She tells us that she learned everything from her mother, who passed on her secret recipes to her. Thanks to this, Gilka is now able to manage her own business. Her dream is to own a proper bakery shop so as not have to peddle her wares. She wants to improve her operations by purchasing baker's tools, such as: a rubber spoon, to mix flour and yeast; stainless steel bowls, in which to make dough, with assorted lids for special types of dough; a scraper, without which there is no removing the dough stuck to the bowl; precision scales, to properly weigh ingredients, especially in small quantities; a measuring jug, so useful when measuring liquids thanks to its markings; measuring spoons, for the precise baker; and of course a rolling pin, that staple of baking. Gilka has been in business for two years, but this is her first loan with the field partner.
She will use the loan to buy baker's tools in order to make traditional pastries.

loans.use: to buy baker's tools to bake traditional pastries.

loans.name: Fredy Andres

texts.es: Andres esta casado, tiene 25 años de edad, son 3 meses que se caso y aun no tiene hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, vive en el campo y es de  la agricultura  de donde tiene sus ingresos, el crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de  abono, fungicidas y para pagar la mano de obra de las personas que trabajan en sus cultivos y le ayudan a tenerlos sanos, la meta que se a propuesto Andres es de seguir trabajando sembrar cultivos mas grandes y dar trabajo a mas personas que trabajan al jornal.
texts.en: Andrés, 25, has been married for three months and does not have any children yet. He is a farmer and raises cattle. He lives in the country, and farming is his only source of income. He will use the loan to buy manure and fungicide and to pay the labourers who help him till the land and keep the crops healthy. Andrés's goal is to buy more land, grow more crops and create more jobs for day labourers.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 18-year-old single man who has been selling and repairing mobile phones for three years to help support his family of nine. 

An ambitious and hard worker who is trying desperately to improve his living conditions, Ahmad wants to start his own mobiles business; he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new collection of cell phones. This loan will help him increase his income and move a step forward toward a better future.

Ahmad hopes to open his own cell phone shop in the future.

loans.use: to start his own business selling mobiles through the purchase of cell phones

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is married with two children, and her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon, and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, treatments, shampoo and braids.  

She works in the shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Jackie's major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. She is aspiring to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, cream relaxers and treatments, etc.

loans.name: Jaclin Rosibel

texts.es:
Jaclin, de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado,  está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Jaclin, se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo. Esta labor se la enseño su padre desde que estaba muy joven.- Ella no tiene otra fuente de ingreso, el lugar en donde ella trabaja está cerca de su casa, lo cual es ventajoso para ella porque no se le dificulta y no incurre en gastos de transporte.- Además, su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día. 

Con el préstamo Jaclin, comprará materiales como cemento,  adobe, madera y teja.- Para hacerle mejoras a su casita. Debido a la época lluviosa,  su casa quedó dañada y se sigue deteriorando.- Además, hay una parte que se está cayendo, por lo tanto urge que se repare lo más pronto posible.  El préstamo le ayudará mucho a Jaclin, ya que sus hijos podrán dormir más tranquilos y seguros y tendrán un lugar más bonito donde vivir.

Los sueños que Jaclin tiene son: ver su casa en buen estado y que sus hijos estudien y se superen.
texts.en:
Jaclin is 30 years old, studied up to third grade, she is married and has two children. Her partner works in agriculture.

Jaclin, works in agriculture with her husband.  She learned this activity from her father since she was very young.  She doesn't have another source of income.  Her place of work is located near her house, which is an advantage because it's not hard for her to get to and she doesn't have transportation costs.  In addition her work schedule is of 5 hours a day.

With the loan Jaclin will buy materials like cement, adobe, wood and tile. She will make improvements to her house.  Due to the rain season her house was damaged and continues to deteriorate.  In addition, there is a portion of the house that is falling down, so it's urgent to repair it as soon as possible.  the loan will help Jaclin a lot, her children will sleep better and safer and they will have a nicer place to live in.

Jaclin's dreams are to see her house in good shape and that her children study and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials to make urgent repairs to her house like cement, adobe, wood and tile.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Gwani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yakubu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Abdulazeez, Ahimu and Sabi'U.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isah spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. Eventually he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state, Nigeria.

In the past, because he needed to pay his pressing expenses, Yohanna would typically have sold his maize soon after harvest, but when prices were lowest. However, now that he is a member of Babban Gona, with their support and this loan, Yohanna can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more.

Yohanna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sani Idi

texts.en:
Sani Idi is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Abubakar, Wasila and Amina.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sani Idi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani Idi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sani Idi  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: take advantage of the soil, planting roughly 7,000 square meters of cacao to generate  income that will permit him to improve his family economy.
